title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: SNP rs2301762 was identified in the analysis of super-variant chr16_4, associated with the gene CLUAP1 that is essential for ciliary functioning, influencing COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: The rs55993634 SNP was located in the CTRB2 locus on chromosome 16 and indicated a significant local genetic correlation between T1D and CAD, underscoring the genetic linkage between these diseases.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: Found in the CFDP1 locus on chromosome 16, the rs8046696 SNP also exhibited local genetic correlation between T1D and CAD, further establishing connections in the shared genetic architecture.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP was associated with ascending aorta minimum area (AAo min area) and demonstrated colocalization with neuroticism, suggesting shared genetic influences between cardiac and mental health traits.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: At the 16p13.11 locus, SNP rs112527105 was identified as a pleiotropic variant shared among MDD, MI, and blood lipid traits, reinforcing the connection between these conditions.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The rs117327757 variant, located at 16q22.1, had a P-value of 8.6×10−6 and OR of 1.80, showing its association in IBD, particularly given its proximity to TNF expression modulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The variant rs139397276 was significantly associated with UC with a P-value of 1.3×10−6 and OR of 3.74, indicating a strong association within the SNX20 gene.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs61736932, located at chr16:50711744, showed an OR of 4.22 and presented an association with a P-value of 1.15×10−6, linking it to UC particularly in the context of the NOD2 gene.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs9939609, associated with the FTO gene, was found to correlate with elevated homocysteine levels in patients with multiple sclerosis (MS) who were screened for vascular risk factors. This finding indicated a potential link between genetic predisposition and vascular comorbidities, which could contribute to disability progression in pwMS.
title: Disability in Multiple Sclerosis is Associated with Vascular Factors: An Ultrasound study

finding: The SNP rs4788115-A was associated with decreased LAT expression, with findings indicating a reduction in endometrial cancer risk while simultaneously increasing the risk of type 1 diabetes.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: This SNP represented a pLoF variant in the <italic>NOD2</italic> gene associated with Crohn's disease.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: A UTR variant in <italic>CETP</italic> associated with HDL cholesterol but non-significant in BBJ.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant was found to have implications in HDL cholesterol in combination with rs1801706.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: A significant missense variant in <italic>CETP</italic> affecting HDL cholesterol.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This synonymous variant in the gene PRKCB was associated with the model for Pred at 100nM, suggesting it may play a role in influencing drug response for IBD patients.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: This intron variant in the gene PRKCB appeared in the model for Pred at 100nM and was considered one of the impactful features tied to variations in drug response.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: This intron variant in PRKCB was included in the set of unique features for the 5-ASA model, suggesting it may influence patient response to this specific treatment.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: This SNP was identified as the likely causal SNP for the oligodendrocyte GRIN2A eQTL with a high causal probability of 0.94. The GRIN2A gene is associated with schizophrenia, suggesting a direct link between this SNP and neuropsychiatric disease risk.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs56407236 was mentioned as a noteworthy variant in the context of AD, identified among previously documented risk loci.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: was functional in the context of MC1R, crucial for pigmentation related to skin cancer.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Mapped to the gene HP, this UTR variant indicated significant associations with multiple proteins and related to lipid and cholesterol levels.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The SNP represented a rare missense variant (p.Ser396Arg) in MMP2 with a significant odds ratio (OR = 6.42), suggesting it played a key role in the risk for DD among Finnish individuals.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP was part of an association signal on chromosome 16q12.2 that achieved genome-wide significance, confirming its involvement in DD.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP in PLCG2 was noted for its gain-of-function mutation and was enriched in centenarians, highlighting its role in protective immunity.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The variant rs111469125 (16:87268090), located inside the C16orf95 gene, was correlated with 19 out of 22 brain regions. It showed significant associations with several ventricle structures, notably with the 3rd and 4th ventricles (3% of total voxels), and the left and right lateral ventricles (1% and 1.5% of total voxels, respectively). Additionally, it correlated with 3% of the voxels of cerebrospinal fluid, and was the only new variant linked to the left cerebellum white matter, left thalamus, and right caudate.
title: TransferGWAS of T1-weighted Brain MRI Data from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs61757601 was one of the seven non-pleiotropic variants that had a significant association with CAD (P=1.3E-14) but did not yield evidence of a causal relationship with serum glycine levels or direct cardioprotection.
title: Effect of Genetic and Dietary Perturbation of Glycine Metabolism on Atherosclerosis in Humans and Mice

finding: The synonymous SNV on TAOK2 (rs4077410) was significantly replicated in the Cox regression, suggesting its association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The variant rs1597000001 in the CETP gene was identified as a population-specific missense variant that was associated with higher levels of HDL-C and lower levels of LDL-C in a cohort of Māori and Pacific peoples. The study observed that this variant led to lower CETP activity and had a significant effect size on HDL-C comparable to that of rare loss-of-function variants in CETP.
title: A population-specific missense variant rs1597000001 in CETP promotes a favorable lipid profile and reduces CETP activity

finding: The SNP rs28449958 was significantly involved in IBD findings due to its linkage with the CARMIL2 gene which is known to have a correlation with early-onset IBD, establishing it as a significant genetic factor in disease risk.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The variant rs7206532 in DYNLRB2 was linked to interactions with the VSX2 locus concerning ONL thickness, adding to the understanding of genetic variability in eye structure.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The study identified rs4133124 at PLCG2 as a novel association with Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD). This variant exhibited significant genetic association (p-value = 2.59 x 10^-6) within the context of GWAS for late AMD, and was found to correlate with increased expression of PLCG2, serving as an eQTL within certain tissues, highlighting its regulatory role in disease progression.
title: Integrating explainable machine learning and transcriptomics data reveals cell-type specific immune signatures underlying macular degeneration

finding: The variant rs1471435 at USP7 was identified as significantly associated with early AMD (p-value = 7.27 x 10^-6), demonstrating its role as a candidate variant of interest in AMD pathology.
title: Integrating explainable machine learning and transcriptomics data reveals cell-type specific immune signatures underlying macular degeneration

finding: The variant rs62033413, located at the FTO locus, illustrated an association between obesity-related traits, including weight, body mass index, and hip circumference, with an increased risk for varicose veins.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: The intron variant rs9921399 at the CES1 locus showed an association with LDL cholesterol levels, with a p-value of 1.37 × 10^-9 and BBJ p-value of 5.5 × 10^-5. While not previously reported in GWAS, this locus was known to be implicated in LDL cholesterol reduction in CES1 deficient mice.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The SNP rs12051220 was identified as part of a study that investigated distinct heterogenic subtypes and molecular signatures associated with African ancestry in Triple Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC). This study utilized quantified genetic ancestry models and revealed that the presence of this SNP was linked to ancestry-associated gene expression profiles that were related to tumor immunological landscapes. These findings suggested that rs12051220 held significance in understanding the racial differences observed in clinical outcomes for African American women suffering from TNBC.
title: African-Ancestry Associated Gene Expression Signatures and Pathways in Triple Negative Breast Cancer, a Comparison across Women of African Descent

finding: The rs11150601 intron variant of SETD1A was found to be significantly associated with schizophrenia, particularly in women within the UK Biobank cohort. The study revealed that the GG genotype significantly increased the risk of schizophrenia in females, with an odds ratio of 1.6 and a p-value of less than 0.001. This SNP was also associated with comorbidities such as obesity and hypertension in patients with schizophrenia, solidifying its role as a major risk factor in neurodevelopmental and psychiatric conditions.
title: The rs11150601 intron variant of SETD1A is associated with female schizophrenia in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The rs2238432-ADCY9 locus was also significantly associated with the risk of stroke in SCD, demonstrating a protective effect with an odds ratio of 0.45 (95% CI 0.29-0.72). This association was attributed to the role of the ADCY9 gene in producing anti-inflammatory cytokines through its cyclase activity.
title: Genetic variants associated with the risk of stroke in sickle cell disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: Similarly, the rs7191721 polymorphism in RBFOX1 also modified the relationship between walking pace and lung cancer. Carriers of a higher number of A alleles displayed stronger protective effects with brisk walking pace, shown by a P-interaction value of 0.01 for lung cancer incidence and 0.004 for mortality. The HR for brisk walking pace in AA genotype carriers was 0.43, significantly reducing their lung cancer risk compared to slow walkers.
title: Endurance and power genes modify the protective effect of fast walking pace on lung cancer risk: a UK Biobank prospective cohort study

finding: This variant was associated with both FEV1 (p-value = 1.00 x 10^-14) and FVC (p-value = 1.10 x 10^-14) in the UK Biobank. It was part of the genetic association signals observed in the analysis linking the NetSHy scores related to COPD, indicating its relevance to lung function.
title: Proteomic Networks and Related Genetic Variants Associated with Smoking and Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

finding: This SNP was part of the four novel loci linked to PCOS, located on chromosome 16 and functioning as an eQTL for the lncRNA MAFTRR. The standardization involved significant genetic correlation analysis within the PCOS meta-analysis.
title: Understanding and Predicting Polycystic Ovary Syndrome through Shared Genetic Architecture with Testosterone, SHBG, and Inflammatory Markers

finding: The SNP rs12102805 was linked to homologous recombination deficiency in ovarian carcinomas. It played a similar role in predicting clinical outcomes, indicating that tumors with this SNP likely showed increased sensitivity to platinum-based chemotherapy and PARPis, reflecting the assay's relevance in clinical settings for identifying patients who might benefit from targeted therapies.
title: Functional homologous recombination assay on FFPE specimens of advanced high-grade serous ovarian cancer predicts clinical outcomes

finding: The SNP rs10775305 was associated with the risk gene ZFP90 for oral cavity cancer (OCC), identified through multi-omics analysis methods, highlighting its potential significance in OCC pathology.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The SNP rs6499103 was found to have associations with the gene CDH16 in the context of OCC susceptibility, as determined by computational approaches to genetic data.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The SNP rs28940579, located in the MEFV gene associated with Familial Mediterranean Fever, exhibited significantly elevated allele frequencies in specific IBD clusters: Armenian (MAF: 0.042, p-value: 1.72e-21), Lebanese Christian (MAF: 0.037, p-value: 1.1e-8), and Egyptian Christian (MAF: 0.033, p-value: 0.00087), compared to the overall biobank frequency (MAF: 5.5e-3). This finding supported existing knowledge about the high burden of Familial Mediterranean Fever in Armenians.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The SNP rs41464951 was found to have a significantly elevated minor allele frequency in the Iranian Non-Jewish cluster (cluster MAF: 0.0051, p-value: 5.02e-5) compared to the biobank frequency (MAF: 8.79e-5). This SNP has been associated with alpha thalassemia, a condition known to be more prevalent in Iranian and Middle Eastern populations.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The SNP rs28562150 at chromosome 16q23.1 was identified as part of the significant loci associated with systolic blood pressure when interacted with the DASH diet score. It had a significant interaction p-value of 3.9e-8 in the meta-analysis of European individuals.
title: Genome-Wide Interaction Analysis with DASH Diet Score Identified Novel Loci for Systolic Blood Pressure

finding: The SNP rs247616 in the CETP locus was associated with HDL-C change in the UK Biobank when adjusted for baseline levels, yielding a significant p-value of 7.77e-10, although this association was not significant in the unadjusted analysis, showcasing the impact of baseline adjustment.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was significantly associated with neuroticism, with T allele carriers showing increased scores. Furthermore, the analysis revealed that rs1421085 was linked to lower subjective well-being through increased neuroticism, while direct associations with alcohol use were not observed, though significant indirect relationships were identified via neuroticism. This SNP was noted for its functional role in influencing FTO gene expression and also showed strong associations across various substance use traits. It was recognized as a vital genetic factor in psychiatric dimensions such as neuroticism and well-being.
title: Examining the association between the FTO gene and neuroticism reveals indirect effects on subjective well-being and problematic alcohol use

finding: Associated with hypertension, rs55936521 was identified in the context of a single variant PheWAS, reinforcing its significance in cardiovascular conditions.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: The rs1805007 variant in the MC1R gene showed a significantly increased log odds ratio for SCC risk in SOTRs, with a 4.8-fold higher effect size compared to non-transplantees (SOTR log (OR)=0.88 vs log (OR)=0.18 in non-transplantees). This finding highlighted the variant's relevance for skin cancer risk specifically in solid organ transplant recipients.
title: Re-weighting MC1R, ASIP and IRF4 risk variants optimises polygenic risk scores for keratinocyte cancer stratification in solid organ transplant recipients

finding: rs7201325 was found within the CLEC16A locus on chromosome 16. Initially, it had a suggestive association in IBD with a p-value of 1.4 × 10-7. Following conditional analysis, it achieved genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.1 × 10-10.
title: Joint analysis reveals shared autoimmune disease associations and identifies common mechanisms

finding: rs55773334 presented as a secondary independent effect in the IBD locus. It had a p-value of 7.6 × 10-5, reinforcing its association with IBD susceptibility.
title: Joint analysis reveals shared autoimmune disease associations and identifies common mechanisms

finding: The rs11248948 polymorphism's GG genotype significantly increased the risk of vascular endothelial dysfunction, with an odds ratio (OR) of 3.971 compared to the CG genotype. Furthermore, its carriage was linked to cerebral small vessel epilepsy, as evidenced by a significant increase in risk with an OR of 3.588.
title: The Mechanism of Vascular Endothelial Dysfunction Induced by Ferroptosis Mediated by NARFL Knockout

finding: For rs2071952, the carriage of CT or TT genotypes newly correlated with a heightened risk of vascular endothelial dysfunction. In particular, the TT genotype significantly increased the risk of cerebral small vessel epilepsy (OR=3.462), highlighting its potential role in neurological disorders.
title: The Mechanism of Vascular Endothelial Dysfunction Induced by Ferroptosis Mediated by NARFL Knockout

finding: The GG and CG genotypes of rs61112891 were linked to a higher risk of vascular endothelial dysfunction with an OR of 3.971 for GG compared to CG, which emphasizes its potential contribution to endothelial damage.
title: The Mechanism of Vascular Endothelial Dysfunction Induced by Ferroptosis Mediated by NARFL Knockout

finding: Carriers of the GA genotype of rs117952680 showed a significantly increased risk for cerebral small vessel epilepsy, with an OR of 5.826, as well as a notable association with neurodegenerative diseases.
title: The Mechanism of Vascular Endothelial Dysfunction Induced by Ferroptosis Mediated by NARFL Knockout

finding: The rs67329386 variant was identified in the ZFHX3 locus with high posterior probability as potentially causal for atrial fibrillation and was located on the binding site of transcription factor CEBPB, suggesting its role in gene regulatory functions.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This FTO variant had significant associations, displaying nearly equal direct and indirect effect sizes on AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Also part of FTO, it contributed similarly to the overall association with AUD through both direct and mediation effects.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: The analysis showed that both homozygous and heterozygous carriers of rs2285814 experienced greater AL growth than wild-type carriers, with p-values of 0.0084 for homozygous and 0.0096 for heterozygous. This variant is located in the intron of the CLUAP1 gene, which is involved in intraflagellar transport maintenance in photoreceptors. The odds ratio for this SNP was 0.36 with a p-value of 0.0021, highlighting its association with increased AL growth.
title: Associations between RetNet gene polymorphisms and efficacy of orthokeratology for myopia control : sample from a clinical retrospective study

finding: rs138572890 was associated with SHS-PC5 and located in the 3' UTR of PAPD5, a gene involved in poly(A) RNA processing and implicated in glucose transporter regulation, thereby highlighting metabolic connections to sleep-related traits.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of composite sleep health scores in 413,904 individuals

finding: SNP rs148281566 showed significant associations in the AFR population (p=1.9 x 10^-09), thus classifying it as a positive and original finding related to cardiovascular traits.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: SNP rs56195233 was identified as a novel variant in the AFR population, significantly associated with cardiovascular traits, thereby establishing it as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: At the ADCY9 locus, rs2531995 was linked to its promoter in natural killer cells and colocalized in skin tissue, underlining its involvement in metabolic traits.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs4784227 was found on chromosome 16q12 within an intron of the CASC16 gene. It was the only GWAS hit directly genotyped in the UK Biobank, showing a hazard ratio of 1.25 and a highly significant P-value of 1.2 × 10^-40. Its association with breast cancer risk was also replicated, supporting the presence of high-risk haplotypes that included it, further validating its role in breast cancer genetics.
title: Potential Misrepresentation of Inherited Breast Cancer Risk by Common Germline Alleles

finding: This SNP was identified as the top hit in the GWEIS, located in an intron of the ABCC1 gene, with a significant association (P = 3.7 × 10^-10) and demonstrated increased risk for depression correlating with higher numbers of stressful life events.
title: Genome-wide by environment interaction study of stressful life events and hospital-treated depression in the iPSYCH2012 sample

finding: The SNP rs2303262 within the MPHOSPH6 gene was associated with longer leukocyte telomere length (LTL) and conferred an increased risk of lung adenocarcinoma with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.43 (95% CI: 2.02-2.92, p=3.8×10^-21). It also exhibited colocalisation with lung adenocarcinoma risk.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: ZNF646/KAT8/BCKDK rs14235 A-carriers exhibited lower UPDRS-III scores compared to GG carriers. Additionally, this SNP impacted small-worldness properties in both gray matter covariance and functional networks.
title: Parkinson’s disease-associated genetic variants synergistically shape brain networks

finding: The SNP rs61732418 in the gene NLRC3 was identified as a predictor of higher levels of injury/inflammation. The T allele of this SNP was associated with an increase of 0.8 SD at a p-value of 0.04, although it was categorized as likely benign (CADD=0.1). There was also a significant mediation effect on dementia symptoms indicated by a p-value of 0.002.
title: Rare variants in IFFO1, DTNB and NLRC3 associate with Alzheimer’s disease CSF profile of neuronal injury and inflammation

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with cluster 5, which related to respiratory- and metabolic disease-related AF. It was identified in genome-wide association studies linking both BMI and AF, indicating a shared genetic contribution between overweight/obesity and AF.
title: Outcome and life expectancy associated with novel subgroups of atrial fibrillation: a data-driven cluster analysis

finding: The rs837763 variant was noted for its association with HbA1C levels. However, it was found that a rare variant gene-level association in the PIEZO1 gene explained a greater proportion of phenotype variance for HbA1C compared to the previously identified common variant at this locus. This indicated that the effects of rare variants, like those in PIEZO1, could potentially augment the understanding of HbA1C levels beyond what was conferred by rs837763.
title: A combined polygenic score of 21,293 rare and 22 common variants significantly improves diabetes diagnosis based on hemoglobin A1C levels

finding: Located in ACSF3, rs4782327 had a MAF of 22% and an OR of 1.17 with a P-value of 8×10^{-9}, linking it significantly with severe disease risk.
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs4788084, associated with IL27, showed a link to autoimmune disease susceptibility but was specifically tied to mLOX, reinforcing the phenotype's connection to immune factors.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: This SNP was associated with decreased TMB in esophagogastric carcinoma and slightly increased expression of the CBFB gene across tissues.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The C allele of rs7201264 was associated with increased TMC in endometrial cancer and decreased expression of the FANCA gene across tissues.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with somatic mutation status of TSC2 in endometrial cancer.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: It was associated with FANCA expression in normal tissues and somatic mutations in FANCA in endometrial tumors.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The SNP rs1614576, located upstream of the PRKCB gene, was found to be associated with early-onset acute myocardial infarction (AMI) with an odds ratio of 1.646 and a p-value of 3.41 × 10^-6. The PRKCB gene is known to play a role in platelet responses that are implicated in thrombus formation.
title: Genome-wide analyses of early-onset acute myocardial infarction identify 29 novel loci by whole genome sequencing

finding: The IL4R variant (rs1805015), associated with slow progression of HIV, was present in 8 patients, underscoring its relevance in HIV susceptibility.
title: Clinical and molecular characterization of COVID-19 hospitalized patients

finding: The SNP rs11075468 was significant in the insulin resistant cluster, with associations identified for fasting insulin and glucose values, as well as homeostatic model assessment of insulin resistance (HOMA-IR). This demonstrated its role in the genetic landscape of PCOS relevant to insulin resistance.
title: Polycystic ovary syndrome susceptibility loci inform disease etiological heterogeneity

finding: SNP rs7206122, an intronic variant in FTO, was identified as associated with AUD.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs183130, located at 16:g.56991363C>T (GRCh37), was robustly identified as a causal variant for both low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) in European populations. The study demonstrated strong evidence of a shared causal variant affecting HDL-C in East Asians as well, supported by a high posterior probability of 1.00 for colocalization. However, while the genetic association for HDL-C was significant, the East Asian GWAS did not reach genome-wide significance for LDL-C at this locus, leading to a low posterior probability for cross-ancestry colocalization (0.22). This variant was crucial in linking CETP inhibition to protective effects against cardiovascular diseases such as coronary heart disease (CHD) and its associated risk factors.
title: Comparing the effect profile of CETP in individuals of East Asian and European ancestries

finding: The SNP rs60847828 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus associated with non-response to SSRIs/SNRIs in a total sample of 135,471 individuals, with a p-value of 1.18e-08. The analysis indicated that it was linked to the gene ABAT, which is implicated in GABA processing and affective disorders.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: The SNP rs13333226 was strongly linked to hypertension in the context of this study. Carriers of a specific allele had both lower urinary uromodulin levels and a reduced risk of developing hypertension. This finding suggested a genetic influence on hypertension risk that was independent of other factors.
title: Association of urinary peptides with hypertension

finding: The variant rs60662530 in the ITGAM gene exhibited a marginally significant association with IgAN (P_BONF = 0.046), suggesting potential relevance to disease risk, although confidence intervals indicated less certainty.
title: Candidate genes for IgA nephropathy in pediatric patients: exome-wide association study

finding: Editing of rs11149612 demonstrated significant changes in chromatin accessibility, and it was confirmed as one of the variants which are in loci identified as liver tissue caQTLs. This suggests a link with gene regulation associated with LDL-C levels.
title: Joint genotypic and phenotypic outcome modeling improves base editing variant effect quantification

finding: The SNP rs7202116 in the FTO locus was among the first reported vQTLs associated with significant variance in body mass index (BMI).
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The variant rs9935936 was associated with the gene GNAO1:RP11-441F2.5 and had a strong p-value of 1.72×10^-9, further implicating this SNP in the genetic landscape of heart failure.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: Cg21375332 mediated 32.7% of the effect of rs604639 on changes in IFN-γ production after BCG vaccination. This CpG site is located near the SLC12A3 and NUP93 genes, with SLC12A3 being recognized as a receptor for the pro-inflammatory cytokine IL-18, contributing to cytokine production such as IFN-γ and IL-6.
title: Epigenetic Reprogramming Mediates Monocyte and Heterologous T Cell-derived Cytokine Responses after BCG Vaccination

finding: The SNP rs8052428-T was significantly associated with shorter sitting height (Beta = -0.101, P value = 1.1E-29) and standing height (Beta = -0.132, P value = 1.0E-17) in a prior genome-wide association study (GWAS) involving 361,194 UK Biobank samples. This finding was noteworthy despite there being no identified causal variant at the locus, indicating that the SV in <italic>WWP2</italic> may act as the causal variant affecting height variation not only in the Han population but also in individuals of European ancestry.
title: Long-read sequencing of 945 Han individuals identifies novel structural variants associated with phenotypic diversity and disease susceptibility

finding: At the CTRB1/2 locus, fine-mapping resolved this variant as a causal signal with a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP=0.989), which improved understanding of its association with T1D.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs12448959 was associated with JH, where the G variant decreased the odds of experiencing high JH levels. This SNP was located in an H3K4me1 enhancer upstream of the ABAT gene and influenced GABA transaminase activity, linking higher JH levels to lower nicotine reward.
title: Genome-wide association study of John Henryism in the CARDIA Cohort suggests a molecular mechanism behind lower nicotine addiction rates

finding: The SNP rs7186490, found in the CACNG3 gene, showed a positive association with plasma OT (β = 1.05, p-value 5.9 × 10^-6). This SNP's association hinted at its role in calcium channel regulation and oxytocin release mechanisms.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: Located upstream of the PRKCB gene, rs7342769 was positively associated with increased plasma OT levels (β = 1.27, p-value 6.2 × 10^-6). This association indicated a potential interaction of PRKCB in oxytocin signaling pathways.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: In the investigated genome-wide association study, the rs9939609 SNP at the FTO locus was shown to have an age-varying association with Body Mass Index (BMI). Specifically, it was found that each additional minor allele (A) was inversely associated with BMI for ages 0 to 3, while a positive association was observed for ages 5.5 to 13. This study's findings supported previously reported associations in other studies that used individual participant data, showing that genetic effects on BMI varied significantly with age.
title: Meta-regression of Genome-Wide Association Studies to estimate age-varying genetic effects

finding: The chr16:28596376:T:C variant related to ST1A1 was identified as a novel association that was common in Inuit ancestry but rare in Europeans.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: Identified as a top-ranking variant by IBI, it plays a role in the explanation of hypertension variations and complements other findings.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The novel SNP rs11645691 was associated with increased risk of CAD in the coronary artery, linked to CFDP1 transcript levels, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.23 [95% CI: 1.14 – 1.33]. This relationship was specifically observed in East Asian populations.
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: The SNP rs9934007 was identified as protective for CAD, associated with CFDP1 transcript levels in both whole blood and lung tissues, confirmed in both Europeans and East Asians. This finding underscored the SNP's role in the regulation of CAD risk.
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: SNP rs2106261 was noted for its association with AF with a P-value of 2.42×10^-7 and an odds ratio of 1.42 in the Taiwanese population, establishing its significance.
title: Identification of two new genetic loci associated with atrial fibrillation in the Taiwanese population-implication of metabolism and fibrosis in atrial fibrillation mechanism

finding: The missense variant rs1181041827 in PKD1 revealed associations with ventral diencephalon volume, with right and left effects being 923.88 mm³ (P = 5.2 × 10^-11) and 945.24 mm³ (P = 1.4 × 10^-11), respectively. This finding emphasized the genetic influence on brain structure variability.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The SNP rs12921187 was identified as the strongest novel association with heart failure (HF). This intronic variant was located within the PPL gene, which encodes periplakin, a protein involved in cytoskeletal cross-linking. Mutations in related proteins have been implicated in arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy associated with left ventricular fibrosis and systolic dysfunction.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The FTO locus SNP rs9940646 was also sign-concordant among all studied cohorts, confirming its relationship with sleep duration.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: At locus 16q24.2, this SNP exhibited a z-score of 6.15 and was involved with asymmetries in supplementary motor cortex connectivity.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: In high LD (r²=0.99) with rs56023709 on 16q24.2, it was previously linked to thalamus volume.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs7404301 was recognized as an intronic variant of RPGRIP1L at locus 16q12.2, showing significant cis-regulatory activity in epigenomic analyses as well as in functional tests.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: The SNP rs9673356 was identified within the 16q12.2 region. It was characterized by its regulatory activity linked to enhancer effects as determined through luciferase assays.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: The SNP rs4783818 was associated with the 16q12.2 locus related to RPGRIP1L, noted for its potential regulatory function, although the effects were not statistically significant.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: In the context of breast cancer, the SNP rs8060055 was highlighted as part of a study that correlated the methylation of the RASSF1C promoter with better survival outcomes in early stage breast cancer patients. This suggested that the genetic variation at rs8060055 potentially influenced the aggressive behavior of cancer cells by modulating RASSF1C expression and function, which is linked with the invasive phenotype and cancer stem cell properties observed in the research.
title: RASSF1C oncogene elicits amoeboid invasion, cancer stemness and invasive EVs via a novel SRC/Rho axis

finding: The G allele frequency in rs17822931 (ABCC11) in Amami-Oshima island (0.311) was significantly higher than in the Hondo cluster (0.121, P < 0.001) but not significantly different from the Ryukyu cluster (0.258, P = 0.123). The G allele frequency in Kikai island (0.118) was significantly lower than in both the Ryukyu cluster (P = 0.044) and Amami-Oshima island (P = 0.015), but not lower than in the Hondo cluster (P = 0.612). This locus is associated with the wet earwax phenotype and axillary osmidrosis.
title: Genetic lineage of the Amami islanders inferred from classical genetic markers

finding: The lead SNP rs9933149 was located in an intron of C16orf95 on chromosome 16 and was significantly associated with endocranial globularity (p = 1.58 x 10^-26). This locus had previous associations with variations in neuroanatomical phenotypes such as sulcal morphology, white matter microstructure, and ventricular volume. Moreover, variants in this region were linked to congenital heart defects and multigene deletions involved in microcephaly and neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Imaging genomics reveals genetic architecture of the globular human braincase

finding: The SNP rs2792 was identified as a significant factor influencing cooking time, with GA genotype showing longer cooking times compared to GG. This intergenic SNP is positioned between the genes Dioal.01G006400 (Tripeptidyl peptidase) and Dioal.01G006500 (Proprotein convertase subtilisin), reflecting its role in culinary traits.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: SNP rs8060501 was identified as an important contributor to the airborne LiDAR data filtering process, which assisted in the accurate measurement of forest biomass and the potential for genetic improvements aimed at enhancing carbon storage capabilities.
title: Quantifying Forest Biomass and Genetic Contribution using Light Detection and Ranging

finding: The SNP rs891134 was identified as significantly affecting the expression of the ADAMTS18 gene. This interaction was observed with Principal Interaction Component 2 (PIC2), and the findings were replicated in two distinct populations: samples of European descent (EUR) and samples of African descent (AFR). The results demonstrated consistent interaction patterns across these populations, with statistical significance corroborated by p-values from an unconditional interaction eQTL analysis.
title: Unbiased identification of unknown cellular and environmental factors that mediate eQTLs using principal interaction component analysis

finding: The variant rs587776991, identified as T2127M, was a gain of function variant in PIEZO1 associated with slowed inactivation kinetics, linked to dehydrated hereditary stomatocytosis. It had strong negative associations with HbA1c levels.
title: Identifying interpretable gene-biomarker associations with functionally informed kernel-based tests in 190,000 exomes

finding: The SNP rs77870048 exhibited associations with two traits in opposite directions, contributing to blood pressure research.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The SNP rs62625284 resulted in L1143P mutation in PALB2, shown to disrupt homologous recombination repair.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: SNP rs6498021 was linked to allergy and asthma and was located near the IL21R locus, indicating its association with B cell regulation in a germinal center context.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: This SNP was found in proximity to IL21R and was also associated with allergy and asthma, demonstrating its relevance to B cell activation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Research indicated rs4784220 as a significant associational finding in breast cancer risk, particularly noted as having large weights assigned in the DOT statistic analysis for the TOX3 gene.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was reported in connection with breast cancer risk variants and was assigned a large weight during statistical analysis within the TOX3 gene context.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: New association with breast cancer risk was identified for SNP rs43143, which featured prominently in the results, contributing to the overall significant findings.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: ERCC4 rs1799801 was associated with platinum response, highlighting its potential as a predictive biomarker for treatment outcomes in colorectal cancer patients receiving platinum-based therapies.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The rs1421085 SNP was identified as a significant factor influencing the differentiation of brown and white adipocytes. It was noted that the presence of the obesity-risk C allele led to a shift towards a white adipocyte gene expression program, which suppressed thermogenic gene expression. Specifically, the T/T genotype was found to preserve the binding of the ARID5B repressor, which inhibited the expression of the IRX3 and IRX5 genes, promoting brown adipocyte differentiation. Conversely, the C/C individuals exhibited lower levels of mitochondrial and thermogenesis-associated genes, affirming this SNP's critical role in adipose tissue biology and obesity.
title: Transcriptome analysis of browning human neck area adipocytes reveals strong influence by the FTO intronic SNP variant in addition to tissue and PPARγ specific regulation

finding: The SNP rs12102822 was associated with the detection of EGFR mutations, specifically identified in a study where bronchial washing-derived extracellular vesicles were used in non-small-cell lung carcinoma patients. This study contributed to the understanding of genetic mutations in tumor-derived extracellular vesicles.
title: Digital Profiling of Tumor Extracellular Vesicle-associated RNAs Directly from Unprocessed Blood Plasma

finding: The rs113496237 variant in the ABCC12 gene was also classified as damaging without specific health implications noted.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing-based Characterization of Human Genome Variation and Mutation Burden in Botswana

finding: The SNP rs11644322 G>A in the WWOX gene was associated with worse prognosis and reduced sensitivity to gemcitabine in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) patients. This suggests that this particular SNP may influence treatment outcomes in individuals affected by this lethal cancer.
title: Loss of tumor suppressor WWOX accelerates pancreatic cancer development through promotion of TGFβ/BMP2 signaling

finding: The SNP rs1238109100 was related to Retinitis pigmentosa and located in the ORF CATP00000005301.1, which is longer (178 amino acids) and predicted to be disordered. The mutation changed the 155th amino acid from Histidine to Tyrosine. The study highlighted a high phenotypic score (47.2) in K562 cells and a strong coding prediction (1,959.299) using an ORF-origin-aware PhyloCSF method, whereas previous estimations had negative scores, emphasizing the importance of correct reading frame assessments.
title: De novo birth of functional, human-specific microproteins

finding: The SNP rs9302752 was identified as an eQTL for the gene NOD2, which is involved in immune response. This association was observed across multiple tissues including whole blood, liver, tibial nerve, spleen, and brain, as sourced from the GTEx dataset. Furthermore, rs9302752 was reported to be associated with leprosy and Crohn's disease in prior GWAS findings. However, in the single-cell analysis of PBMC data, the correlation between rs9302752 and NOD2 expression, although present (R=0.12), was not statistically significant when using the Z-scores method, with a nominal P-value of 0.07. Significant links were instead found with other genes, indicating complexities in peak-gene link assessments.
title: Major cell-types in multiomic single-nucleus datasets impact statistical modeling of links between regulatory sequences and target genes

finding: SNP rs8047395 provided evidence for an association with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in the EstFin panel with a low P value of 4.4 × 10^-11. It was also significant in the 1000G imputation but with a different lead variant indicating its relevance in T2D.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was identified as a significant associate with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in the context of the 1000G reference dataset, having its lowest P value at 7.9 × 10^-11, showcasing trait relevance.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The CETP polymorphism rs1800775 (629A) was found to reduce CETP lipid transfer activity by 21-51% compared to wild type CETP. This reduction in activity was associated with a lower risk of Alzheimer's disease in patients expressing the apolipoprotein E isoform 4 (APOE4), which is noted as a significant genetic risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: The CETP polymorphism rs5882 (I405V) correlated with lower CETP protein expression and higher HDL-C levels. This SNP was significantly associated with exceptional longevity and healthy aging in centenarians from the Ashkenazi Jewish population, indicating a potential link to longevity and the maintenance of cognitive performance.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: The SNP rs12051307 was associated with one or more fibroblast populations in breast cancer, as identified through single-cell transcriptomic analysis. This study highlighted the heterogeneity of tumor-derived fibroblasts and normal tissue-resident fibroblasts, suggesting that this SNP plays a significant role in understanding fibroblast dynamics in breast cancer.
title: CD26-negative and CD26-positive tissue-resident fibroblasts contribute to functionally distinct CAF subpopulations in breast cancer

finding: The stop gained variant in IL34 (rs4985556) associated with greater Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk and was connected with reduced levels of IL34, indicating its functional relevance to the disease.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The SNP rs1805007 in the MC1R gene was significantly associated with self-perceived facial aging. Carriers of the alleles responsible for lower pigmentation were more likely to report looking older than their actual age. The association was highlighted with a p-value of E-6.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs12051341 was associated with small molecule KRAS inhibitors, which are considered pivotal for targeted therapy in pancreatic cancer. The context of this finding relates to the study of pharmacological reactions within cells treated with AMG510, a covalent inhibitor targeting the KRAS<sup>G12C</sup> mutation. This suggests that genetic variations in the vicinity of rs12051341 could influence the efficacy of KRAS-targeted therapies.
title: Single Cell Proteomics Using a Trapped Ion Mobility Time-of-Flight Mass Spectrometer Provides Insight into the Post-translational Modification Landscape of Individual Human Cells

finding: The SNP rs17822931 in the ABCC11 gene was associated with the dry ear wax phenotype. In mainland Japanese, Jomon-derived haplotypes containing this SNP exhibited a frequency of 24% for the derived allele (dry ear wax) and 10.6% for the ancestral allele (wet ear wax). Previous studies indicated that this derived allele was present in the Hokkaido Jomon population at a frequency of 47.6%, which supports the notion that modern Japanese carry alleles inherited from the Jomon people.
title: Comprehensive analysis of Japanese population history by detecting ancestry-marker polymorphisms without using ancestral genomic information

finding: This SNP was identified in the cross-trait analysis linking MS with CD.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The variant rs11075995 was associated with increased variability in the expression of genes involved in the C21-steroidal biosynthesis pathway specifically in breast tissue. This SNP was linked to the risk of ER negative breast cancer, with the A/A homozygous genotype correlating to significantly altered expression of four candidate genes (CYP11B1, CYP17A1, HSD3B2, and STAR). Pathway analysis revealed that these genes are crucial for converting cholesterol to important hormones.
title: Variable expression quantitative trait loci analysis of breast cancer risk variants

finding: The SNP rs140124801 in KCNG4 was found to be associated with reduced labor pain in a cohort of 196 women who did not request analgesia during their first labor. The rare allele of this SNP created a missense mutation, converting Valine 419 to Methionine (p.Val419Met), which impaired the trafficking of K_V6.4 to the plasma membrane. As a result, the mutant allele exhibited a dominant-negative effect on the modulation of K_V2.1 inactivation, leading to decreased excitability of sensory neurons and ultimately resulting in higher pain thresholds during labor.
title: Human labor pain is influenced by the voltage-gated potassium channel KV6.4 subunit

finding: The lead variant rs55872725 in the FTO locus was linked to the percentage fat in milk. Its effect size was reported to reduce significantly, from 0.0045 to 0.0015 log units after accounting for health-related traits, particularly BMI. This finding highlighted that the association between this SNP and food traits is primarily mediated through its strong correlation with BMI, indicating that higher BMI may lead to healthier food choices rather than the reverse.
title: Using genetics to disentangle the complex relationship between food choices and health status

finding: The SNP rs1558902, a variant in the FTO gene locus, exhibited significant gene-by-birth year effects on Body Mass Index (BMI). This finding replicated earlier results indicating increasing penetrance of the FTO variant over historical time, with a significant environmental heterogeneity estimate (p value of 5.1e-07), suggesting that the observed interaction was not merely a byproduct of a general modulation of variance.
title: Heteroscedastic regression modeling elucidates gene-by-environment interaction

finding: For the SNP rs2066842 in the NOD2 locus, it was noted that this effective allele is a risk factor for Crohn’s disease. The Picene group exhibited the highest frequency of this effective allele compared to other Italian populations over time and relative to coeval groups, indicating a distinct genetic signature among the Picenes.
title: The Genomic portrait of the Picene culture: new insights into the Italic Iron Age and the legacy of the Roman expansion in Central Italy

finding: Research indicated that rs2280381 served as a causal variant regulating IRF8 expression. The locus containing rs2280381 was identified as a cell-type-specific distal enhancer for IRF8, interacting with its promoter. Functional studies based on CRISPR deletion demonstrated that disrupting rs2280381 led to a dramatic reduction in IRF8 expression. The findings also established that the alleles of rs2280381 modulated PU.1 binding and chromatin state, further influencing IRF8 and the lncRNA AC092723.1, crucial for autoimmune diseases like SLE.
title: CRISPRa screen on a genetic risk locus shared by multiple autoimmune diseases identifies a dysfunctional enhancer that affects IRF8 expression through cooperative lncRNA and DNA methylation machinery

finding: The SNP rs1800775 was replicated in the HDL analysis, with a PIP of 1.00 under the BANNs framework, indicating a consistent and strong association with HDL cholesterol levels across studies.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: rs58726213 was associated with psoriasis and was identified as having allele-specific binding (ASB) involving CREB1 (reference allele preference) and JUN (alternative allele preference). It was located in the STX4 intron or upstream region and was significantly down-regulated in psoriasis, serving as an eQTL for STX4 and HSD3B7, the latter also being a psoriasis susceptibility locus.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: SNP rs1800775 was associated with the CETP gene and identified as part of the HDL particle remodeling function. It showed a significant correlation with TG/HDL levels, with p < 10-85, indicating it plays an important role in modulating triglyceride and HDL cholesterol levels.
title: Mechanistic genotype-phenotype translation using hierarchical transformers

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was associated with ASAT volume and demonstrated connections with multiple body composition traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs6498540 was used as an instrumental variable for DGLA in a study examining the causal relationships between metabolites and BMI. The findings indicated a significant relationship at the 0.05 level, with a supporting p-value of 0.0327, further implicating DGLA's role in influencing BMI.
title: Bayesian network analysis complements Mendelian randomization approaches for exploratory analysis of causal relationships in complex data

finding: The variant rs145650870 generated a transcription factor binding site (TFBS) for EHF and was associated with increased enhancer activity for three nearby genes in the ASD risk locus at 16p11.2.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The SNP rs8043757 was characterized as an obesity-associated variant that decreased binding affinity for FOXP3, which regulates neighboring genes IRX3 and IRX5. In astrocytes, CRISPR-based inactivation of the FTO enhancer containing this SNP resulted in significantly reduced expression of FTO, IRX3, and IRX5, demonstrating its role in modulating gene expression associated with obesity.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of hypothalamus sex-differential and obesity-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs2080512 was located in an intergenic region 13 kb upstream of the gene LITAF. The alternative allele, T, was associated with reduced H3K27ac peak heights and consequently reduced gene expression of LITAF. It had been previously linked with cardiac electrocardiographic QT interval elongation in GWAS.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: This SNP was in linkage disequilibrium with rs2080512 (R2=0.83), which was significantly associated with QT interval traits in a GWAS context.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: Similar to rs8049607, rs735951 was also in linkage disequilibrium with rs2080512 (R2=0.94) and was connected to the QT interval variant findings in prior GWAS.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs12102764 was found to be associated with replication dynamics in cancer settings, particularly in triple negative breast cancers. The findings indicated that aberrant DNA replication processes, possibly related to the influence of this SNP, drive the evolution of human tumors by affecting cell cycle regulation and replication timing variability.
title: Modeling single cell DNA replication dynamics and aneuploidy in genomically unstable cancers

finding: The SNP rs7190458, significant in previous GWAS, was underlined in its role within BCAR1 associated with pancreatic cancer progression.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: This SNP had a P-value of 2.52x10^-253 and owned a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99. It is considered potentially more functionally important than rs17231506 regarding HDL-C.
title: A multi-dimensional integrative scoring framework for predicting functional variants in the human genome

finding: Similar to rs72786786, this SNP's P-value was 1.89x10^-260, also having a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99, further supporting its potential functional relevance in the HDL-C associated locus.
title: A multi-dimensional integrative scoring framework for predicting functional variants in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs12051347 was associated with pancreatic cancer, particularly linked to the role of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in tumor progression. Within the context of the study, it highlighted the importance of CAFs, specifically their transformation from healthy fibroblasts, and their significant contribution to immune surveillance in pancreatic tumors.
title: CAF variants control the tumor-immune microenvironment and predict skin cancer malignancy

finding: The SNP rs11644125 was found to be associated with monocyte and lymphocyte blood cell counts, with a fine-mapping showing greater than 0.99 causal probability. Enformer predicted that the minor allele T decreased expression of NLRC5 in whole blood compared to the major allele C, correlating with its regulatory influence shown through improved predictions in relevant CAGE samples. These findings suggested perturbation of the SP1 transcription factor motif, proposing this variant as a mechanism affecting NLRC5 expression in hematopoietic cells.
title: Effective gene expression prediction from sequence by integrating long-range interactions

finding: The SNP rs8050413 was positively associated with the ability to produce Land Surface Temperature (LST) maps, as demonstrated in the study by Ndossi and Avdan in 2016. The finding highlighted the relevance of this SNP in the application of open source coding technologies for environmental monitoring, indicating its utility in mapping and analyzing temperature variations which can be crucial for understanding habitats of species like Aedes albopictus.
title: Aedes albopictus bionomics in Procida Island, a promising Mediterranean site for the assessment of innovative and community-based integrated pest management methods

finding: At the alpha-globin locus enhancer cluster, the rs11864973 variant altered an activating KLF1 site to a repressive SNAI1, affecting transcriptional regulation in a functionally relevant manner.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The SNP rs12446999-A was associated with aggression symptoms in individuals, and this association had a Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney p value of 0.028.
title: USP7/Maged1-Mediated H2A Monoubiquitination in the Paraventricular Thalamus: An Epigenetic Mechanism Involved in Cocaine Use Disorder

finding: The SNP rs7342770 was found to be significantly associated with aggression symptoms as well, with a more pronounced association reflected in a Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney p value of 0.0014.
title: USP7/Maged1-Mediated H2A Monoubiquitination in the Paraventricular Thalamus: An Epigenetic Mechanism Involved in Cocaine Use Disorder

finding: The risk allele T of SNP rs12929673 was associated with lower expression of TERF2IP in females while showing higher expression in males, suggesting a protective role for lower TERF2IP expression against atherosclerosis.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The risk allele of SNP rs7195958 was positively associated with SMC proliferation and higher expression of DHODH in quiescent SMCs, suggesting its influence in the CAD mechanism.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The SNP rs8046859 was characterized as an sQTL for the gene ATXN1L specifically in nerve tibial tissue but not in muscle skeletal tissue. It was not associated with expression levels of ATXN1 in either tissue, while it was an eQTL for the gene IST1 in muscle skeletal tissue, illustrating a heteropleiotropic locus.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs11647069 was noted in terms of associations with various phenotypic traits, suggesting a role in metabolism and possibly in gut microbiota composition.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: The SNP rs11642657 was linked to monocyte counts, exhibiting a larger effect size compared to the common noncoding variant at the IRF8 locus. This SNP was part of an extended allelic series that included pLoF CNVs and various PTVs, illustrating its regulatory importance in monocyte differentiation.
title: Influences of rare copy number variation on human complex traits

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was associated with transcriptional regulation related to pH dynamics in cancer. It was identified in a study that highlighted the importance of pH in cancer cell behavior, indicating that variations in this SNP may influence how cancer cells manage pH changes, which are critical for processes like vasculogenic mimicry.
title: Intracellular pH dynamics respond to microenvironment stiffening and mediate vasculogenic mimicry through β-catenin

finding: The SNP rs12051080 was identified in studies regarding acquired resistance in YM155-adapted cancer cell lines. This SNP contributed to the discovery of drug-induced heterogeneity, reinforcing its role as a biomarker candidate related to resistance in TNBC.
title: Resistance patterns in drug-adapted cancer cell lines reflect the complex evolution in clinical tumours

finding: The SNP rs1805007 in the FANCA gene was linked to increased risk for melanoma and non-melanomatous skin cancer. It was primarily associated with standing height within anthropometric measures.
title: Heritable genetic variants in key cancer genes link cancer risk with anthropometric traits

finding: This SNP was identified as one of several SNPs within regions controlling the expression of CLEC16A, a gene differentially expressed in AD brains, highlighting its potential role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: Interacting with both rs12926153 and rs9652600, this SNP was located within DNAse regions implicated in the regulation of CLEC16A expression, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in AD.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: Along with rs12922908, this SNP was found in regions involved in regulating CLEC16A, reinforcing its potential as a significant contributor to Alzheimer’s disease mechanisms.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs1532624 associated with CETP was previously linked to age-related macular degeneration, indicating its importance in both lipid metabolism and associated pathologies.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs9939609 was originally found to be associated with obesity-related traits, particularly linked to FTO gene variants. The study by Lewis et al. (2010) demonstrated that this obesity-related genetic variant indicated a significant relation to prostate cancer risk. This finding suggested that the impact of the FTO gene variant extends beyond obesity into the realm of cancer risk factors.
title: m6A-TSHub: unveiling the context-specific m6A methylation and m6A-affecting mutations in 23 human tissues

finding: For SNP rs12102757, a significant correlation was observed between AXL inactivation and the regulation of p53 expression, indicating that this SNP may influence mesothelioma growth and migration, highlighting its potential impact on EMT processes.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals microenvironment context-specific routes for epithelial-mesenchymal transition in pancreas cancer cells

finding: The variant rs8048449 was identified as strongly associated with the red hair phenotype, accounting for 25% of the weight mass in the TUBB3 gene expression estimates. This marked the variant as a significant contributor to the trait's manifestation.
title: Learning epistatic polygenic phenotypes with Boolean interactions

finding: The intronic variant rs12925026 within the gene ZNF276 had previously achieved genome-wide significance for association with non-melanoma skin cancer. ZNF276 was recognized as a candidate tumor suppressor gene in breast cancer, linking this SNP to pathways involved in breast carcinogenesis.
title: Pleiotropy-guided transcriptome imputation from normal and tumor tissues identifies new candidate susceptibility genes for breast and ovarian cancer

finding: The SNP rs8050384 was associated with changes in global grassland productivity due to climatic factors, as detailed in the study by Gao et al. (2016). This finding highlighted the impact of climatic changes on the productivity of grasslands, providing relevant context for understanding how genetic factors might influence species' responses to climatic shifts, particularly in relation to drought conditions similar to those observed in the Pastures and Climate Extremes experiment.
title: Pastures and Climate Extremes: Impacts of cool season warming and drought on the productivity of key pasture species in a field experiment

finding: The SNP rs16940186 was identified as a likely causal risk variant for ulcerative colitis. It resided within an intergenic cis-regulatory element (cCRE) that was specifically accessible in epithelial cells of the gastrointestinal tract, including enterocytes and goblet cells. This cCRE was predicted to influence the transcription of the gene IRF8, which is involved in immune cell maturation and innate immunity in gastric epithelium. Notably, the risk allele of rs16940186 functioned as an eQTL associated with increased IRF8 expression in human colon tissue. Furthermore, motif disruption analysis showed that the risk allele created a binding site for ETS family transcription factors that are likely involved in intestinal epithelial maturation.
title: A cell atlas of chromatin accessibility across 25 adult human tissues

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was identified as a significant finding linked to the regulation of the NRF2 signaling pathway, which is crucial for understanding its role in lung tumorigenesis. The research indicated that mutations such as Nrf2<D29H> in lung tumors could have implications for cancer progression and metabolic processes within the tumor microenvironment.
title: Distinct Roles for the Thioredoxin and Glutathione Antioxidant Systems in Nrf2-Mediated Lung Tumor Initiation and Progression

finding: The rs3794624 polymorphism in CYBA was linked with decreased susceptibility to TB in another study of Chinese Han persons. This indicated a potential role of CYBA in modulating oxidative stress responses and immune function, relevant to individuals demonstrating persistent negative TB test results despite HIV infection.
title: Altered neutrophil extracellular traps in response to Mycobacterium tuberculosis in persons living with HIV with no previous TB and negative TST and IGRA

finding: SNP rs9931589 was part of the set showing lower SA of the parietal operculum in ADHD, contributing to the understanding of brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs79691782 was positively associated with greater thickness in the perisylvian cortex for anxiety, underscoring its influence.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs8050427 was linked to the study conducted by Jantz et al. in 2016, which investigated the near real-time monitoring of chimpanzee habitats in Africa using Landsat ETM+ and SRTM data. The finding highlighted the importance of environmental and anthropogenic factors in predicting habitat conditions for the species, reinforcing the role of SNPs in understanding genetic adaptations to habitat changes.
title: Predicting range shifts of African apes under global change scenarios

finding: With a p-value of 7.34×10^-10, rs4889599 was located in the promoter of SETD1A, a component of a histone methyltransferase complex involved in regulating histone modifications, which may indirectly contribute to PD by affecting gene expression.
title: Parkinson’s Disease Genetic Risk Evaluation in Microglia Highlights Autophagy and Lysosomal Genes

finding: The SNP rs12051290 was linked to obesity-associated hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) as noted in Rajesh and Sarkar's study, which discussed the molecular mechanisms regulating this association. This finding indicated that genetic variations at this locus might influence susceptibility to HCC through obesity-related pathways.
title: Hybrid Adipocyte-Derived Exosome Nano Platform for Potent Chemo-Phototherapy in Targeted Hepatocellular Carcinoma

finding: The FTO rs1421085 obesity-risk allele was associated with suppressed expression of mitochondrial and thermogenesis-related genes. Specifically, it was observed that individuals carrying the obesity-risk alleles CC had lower expression of ThTr2 in neck fat-derived adipocytes compared to those with healthy alleles TT. This indicated a potential role of ThTr2 in energy metabolism, especially in the context of thermogenesis and obesity.
title: Availability of abundant thiamine determines efficiency of thermogenic activation in human neck area derived adipocytes

finding: In the study, rs8053350 was identified as a dynamic eQTL SNP associated with varicose veins and the expression of RNF166. This SNP is located within an intron of the PIEZO1 gene. Varicose veins are linked to an increased risk for developing deep vein thrombosis and other vascular diseases. Additionally, further analysis on genes connected to myocardial infarction (MI), heart failure, and stroke revealed that this SNP is also associated with the expression of ZC3HC1, a heart eGene implicated in MI, coronary artery disease, and ischemic stroke. Furthermore, rs8053350 was reported to be associated with bronchodilator responsiveness in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
title: Dynamic effects of genetic variation on gene expression revealed following hypoxic stress in cardiomyocytes

finding: The SNP rs11076256, a missense variant Gly188Ser in GOT2, showed a strong association with AST levels (p = 6.3 x 10^-62), establishing it as a critical genetic variant affecting liver enzyme activity.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The SNP rs9937140 located upstream of the APOOP5 gene on chromosome 16 showed an association with cryptosporidiosis, conferring 1.99 times the odds of developing the infection. This suggests that genetic variations in this region may also play a role in the susceptibility to Cryptosporidium infections in early childhood.
title: Genome-wide association study of cryptosporidiosis in infants implicates PRKCA

finding: The lead SNP rs34177108 on chromosome 16 was identified as related to the NonEA-INC factor in a genome-wide significant manner. This locus had previous associations with vitamin D levels and traits related to hair and skin, highlighting potential connections to discrimination in the labor market.
title: Associations between common genetic variants and income provide insights about the socioeconomic health gradient

finding: The SNP rs12103014 was identified in the study by Shramova et al. (2020), which involved dual targeting of cancer cells with DARPin-based toxins. The study illustrated that this particular SNP correlates with improved effectiveness of targeting HER2-positive tumors, thereby providing valuable insights into therapeutic strategies for breast cancer.
title: Internalization-Responsive Nano-PLGA For Image-Guided Photodynamic Therapy Against HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

finding: The rs2106261 SNP was located in the first intron of ZFHX3. It was involved in a region exhibiting regulatory potential, as deletion of the ZFHX3-AF regulatory element resulted in increased expression of ZFHX3 in cell lines, establishing its role as a significant enhancer in AF regulation.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: Also situated within the ZFHX3-AF regulatory element, the rs2359171 SNP acted similarly to rs2106261, being part of the regulatory region that influenced ZFHX3 expression. The deletion experiments reaffirmed its involvement as a critical regulatory variant linked to AF.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs6420415 was located in an intron of CDYL2 and was predicted to negatively affect FOXA1 binding due to alterations in the FORKHEAD motif. Western blot analysis confirmed that FOXA1 binding was diminished in the presence of the rSNP. Carriers of the G allele exhibited an elevated risk of developing breast cancer, possibly through reduced expression of CDYL2, as indicated by TCGA gene expression data.
title: Breast cancer risk SNPs converge on estrogen receptor binding sites commonly shared between breast tumors to locally alter estrogen signalling output
