finding: The SNP rs11642015 in the FTO gene was associated with adiposity, contributing to a negative Wald ratio indicating an association with lower risk of Parkinson's disease (PD). This finding emphasized the role of adiposity in lowering PD risk.
title: The Parkinson’s Disease Mendelian Randomization Research Portal

finding: The SNP rs62048402, also located in the FTO gene, was linked with impedance measurements; however, its exclusion did not alter the overall results. Its association confirmed the relationship between adiposity and PD risk.
title: The Parkinson’s Disease Mendelian Randomization Research Portal

finding: In the AC106729.1 gene, this SNP showed weak associations across various traits but had notable associations with coronary atherosclerosis and triglycerides.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The VKORC1 polymorphism rs9923231, which causes warfarin sensitivity, was very common in East Asian populations, with an occurrence of 89.95%. In contrast, it was comparatively less common in African populations at 10.09%, demonstrating significant population variability in relation to this gene's impact.
title: Potential impact on coagulopathy of gene variants of coagulation related proteins that interact with SARS-CoV-2

finding: The SNP rs11248850 was identified within a known enhancer element regulating α-globin genes, emerging as one of the potential causative alleles for various hematic traits, including RBC count, confirmed through massively parallel reporter assays.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: The SNP rs3743673 was identified as significantly associated with body size traits both across mammals and in collaborative cross mice, with its position located within QTL intervals linked to body weight.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was implicated in the regulatory mechanisms between NRF2 signaling and metabolic processes in cancer, as detailed in the research by DeBlasi and DeNicola (2020). This SNP was suggested to influence metabolic adaptations in melanoma, highlighting its potential role in modulating tumor behavior through metabolic pathways.
title: The small MAF transcription factor MAFG co-opts MITF to promote melanoma progression

finding: The SNP rs12102913 was linked to oncogenic mutations in MYD88, as reported by Visco et al. This finding suggested that individuals with this variant might experience different outcomes in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, potentially influencing clinical practices related to TLR signaling pathways and therapeutic strategies.
title: Metadichol an agonist/antagonist that expresses the Toll Like Receptor family in various Cancer Cell Lines and its potential Impact on Cancer Treatment

finding: Located between the genes Ciita and Socs1, the SNP rs6498169 showed chromatin accessibility specifically in EAE-OPCs and MOLs, indicating its relevance in inflammation regulation pathways altered during MS. Accessibility was absent in controls, highlighting its potential role in the disease.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs61747071 at the RPGRIP1L locus, a missense loss-of-function mutation (A229T), showed a significant association with a p-value of 2.09 × 10-9, making it a notable novel signal implicated in neurological disorders.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: This SNP was identified in the study focusing on the rationale for combined immunotherapy with PD-1/PD-L1 antibodies and VEGF inhibitors in advanced hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). The findings highlighted its potential role in patient response to immunotherapy.
title: Informing virtual clinical trials of hepatocellular carcinoma with spatial multi-omics analysis of a human neoadjuvant immunotherapy clinical trial

finding: The study demonstrated that synthetic DNA could effectively flip the genotype at the rs17822931 locus from the homozygous CC to homozygous TT when spiked at concentrations greater than 10 ng. Intermediate quantities resulted in partial flips to CT or no calls, confirming the manipulation of DTC genotyping outcomes through spiked synthetic DNA.
title: Doctoring Direct-to-Consumer Genetic Tests with DNA Spike-Ins

finding: The rs16260 SNP, a C to A substitution in the CDH1 promoter at chr16:68737131, was previously identified as a cancer-specific risk factor. In the study, it was observed that the A allele was present within 0% of reads in neural stem cells (NSC) and 38% of reads in GBM Nx18-25 cells. This SNP is associated with impaired transcription and demonstrates its clinical significance in cancer research.
title: Flap-enabled next-generation capture (FENGC): precision targeted single-molecule profiling of epigenetic heterogeneity, chromatin dynamics, and genetic variation

finding: This SNP at the PDILT/UMOD locus was associated with kidney-related biomarkers, supporting associations with hypertension.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The SNP rs10468280 at the FTO locus was identified as significantly associated with sex in a GWAS involving approximately 3.3 million males and females. The study found that the body mass index (BMI) increasing allele at this locus was present at a higher frequency in males than in females with an odds ratio of 1.02 (confidence interval: 1.02-1.03) and a p-value of 4.4x10^-36 in the 23andMe dataset. A similar effect was observed in the UK Biobank with an odds ratio of 1.02 (confidence interval: 1.01-1.03) and a p-value of 3.6x10^-5. Moreover, Mendelian randomization analyses indicated a causal effect of BMI on sex in both datasets, although there were significant variations in the relationship between BMI variants and sex across the two studies.
title: Genetic analyses identify widespread sex-differential participation bias

finding: This lead signal at the CLUAP1 locus was classified as shared with comparable TOA scores across four T2D-relevant tissues, indicating multifaceted contributions.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with overall breast cancer risk (P=4.67E-20), as well as ER-positive (P=2.48E-13) and ER-negative breast cancer (P=1.56E-09), indicating a notable genetic implication.
title: Coffee consumption and risk of breast cancer: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The SNP rs2286974 was analyzed in relation to a novel stop-gain variant in the SOCS1 gene identified in a patient. This SNP was phased with the SOCS1 variant to understand its contribution to the patient's condition. The research indicated that this SNP along with the novel SOCS1 variant contributed to the understanding of the interplay between common and rare genetic variants in PID, suggesting a complex genetic architecture influencing clinical outcomes.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing of Primary Immunodeficiency reveals a role for common and rare variants in coding and non-coding sequences

finding: The variant rs183130 at the CETP locus was associated with reduced LDL-C levels, showing a beta of -1.568 mg/dL (p-value = 2.88×10^-9) and was notably more associated among African ancestry individuals with a beta of -2.762 mg/dL (p-value = 5.71×10^-7). This finding related to lipid genetics indicated a significant role for this genetic variant in managing LDL-C.
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: The rs3764261 variant at the CETP locus had a strong association with increased HDL-C levels (beta = 3.5 mg/dL, p-value = 8.03×10^-283), reinforcing its relevance in HDL metabolism and confirming its role in lipid profiles.
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: The SNP rs10445003 was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and initially did not have eQTL colocalization. However, through meta-analysis, a stronger association with CIITA expression was uncovered (p = 6.7×10^-8), which demonstrated significant colocalization with the caQTL signal.
title: Chromatin accessibility variation provides insights into missing regulation underlying immune-mediated diseases

finding: For the trait MCH, rs13331259, which was identified on chromosome 16, was also chosen based on having the lowest p-value among the associations, thus demonstrating its significance in contributing to the variance explained in the trait.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: This SNP, a missense variant in ABCC11, was recognized for its involvement in sweat and earwax production in East Asian populations.
title: Ohana: detecting selection in multiple populations by modelling ancestral admixture components

finding: The SNP rs373256534, represented as chrE3:g.42850283C>T (p.Arg2162Trp), was identified as a damaging variant in a study focusing on autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD) in cats. This variant was unique to the ADPKD cases and was absent in healthy controls, indicating its potential role in the pathogenesis of ADPKD in this feline population. Notably, it was found to be identical to a human variant associated with ADPKD, which underscores the relevance of this finding in comparative genetics.
title: Large-scale epidemiological study on feline autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease and identification of novel PKD1 gene variants

finding: The SNP rs113001936 on chromosome 16 was found to be significant with Bonferroni correction in the context of a study examining participation in genetic studies. It was identified through a genome-wide analysis comparing allele frequencies in shared genetic segments of first-degree relatives, suggesting a relationship between this SNP and the inclination to participate in genetic research. Although a literature search did not provide clear reasons for its association, the analysis indicated that rs113001936 contributed to the understanding of genetic contributions to participation, further emphasizing its relevance in the context of behavioral traits related to participation in studies.
title: The Genetics of Participation: Method and Analysis

finding: This SNP showed association with pancreatic volume (p=2.9e-15, beta=0.11) which aligns with diabetes-related traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: This SNP was associated with pancreatic fat (p=1.1e-12, beta=0.06) and colocalised with tissue-specific gene expression relevant to pancreatic function.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: This SNP was located in an intron of the Interleukin-27 (IL-27) gene, which was found to be significantly associated with Crohn's disease (CD) and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). IL-27 is known to be produced by macrophages and has been implicated in the regulation of the immunological response in IBD. The finding highlighted its potential as a new drug target for IBD, given its role in chronic inflammation of the digestive tract.
title: Scalable ultra-high-throughput single-cell chromatin and RNA sequencing reveals gene regulatory dynamics linking macrophage polarization to autoimmune disease

finding: The rs7500448 variant was located at the CDH13 locus, found within smooth muscle cell peaks and associated with CAD risk.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The variant rs4782568 was linked to multiple complex traits, as it was predicted by the ABC Model to regulate the gene OSGIN1 in hepatocytes. This gene is involved in cellular growth regulation and its transcriptional regulation may influence metabolic functions in the liver.
title: Genome-wide maps of enhancer regulation connect risk variants to disease genes

finding: The more frequent loss-of-function variant p.Gln48Ter was found to be greater than 20-fold enriched in a cohort of Hong Kong Chinese patients suffering from Alzheimer's disease, demonstrating its association with this neurodegenerative condition.
title: A common human MLKL polymorphism confers resistance to negative regulation by phosphorylation

finding: The hypomorphic <italic>MLKL</italic> missense gene variant p.G316D was reported to be associated with Maturity Onset Diabetes of the Young, linking it to this specific metabolic condition.
title: A common human MLKL polymorphism confers resistance to negative regulation by phosphorylation

finding: The polymorphism <italic>MLKL S132P</italic> (rs35589326) had a global minor allele frequency of 0.0138, indicating it was carried by 2-3% of the human population. It was notably absent in individuals of East Asian ancestry and showed increased frequency among Ashkenazi Jewish individuals, emphasizing its potential impact on necroptosis-related disorders.
title: A common human MLKL polymorphism confers resistance to negative regulation by phosphorylation

finding: The SNP rs35219837 was associated with the expression of <italic>PGAP6</italic> in the context of TB-T2D vs T2D comparison and with ancestry adjustments.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs759202 was found to affect the expression of <italic>MRPL28</italic> in the comparisons between TB-T2D and T2D patients, adjusted for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs113496159 was also associated with the expression of <italic>MRPL28</italic> when comparing TB-T2D patients with T2D patients.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs17677328 was linked with the expression of <italic>MRPL28</italic>, similar to other MRPL28-associated SNPs in the patient comparison context.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs11150606 was noted as a phenotype-related variant in East Asian populations, notably associated with scalp hair shape. The C allele was found to be related to a decreased dose of Warfarin compared to the T allele (p = 0.0221). The frequency of the C allele was significantly higher in East Asian populations (over 76.4%) compared to lower frequencies in other populations. This mutation was identified as strongly favored in East Asians (DFscore values ranged from 0.651 to 0.795 across various populations), highlighting its association with both hair morphology and Warfarin metabolism.
title: PopTradeOff: a database for exploring population-specific trade-offs between adaptive evolution, disease susceptibility, and drug responsiveness

finding: The variant rs138628476, encoding p.Gly169Glu in SEPT12, was reported to cause male subfertility in mouse models. This finding was attributed to the variant's effect on protein-protein interactions that are crucial for normal reproductive function.
title: In vivo versus in silico assessment of potentially pathogenic missense variants in human reproductive genes

finding: Identified as a high severity SNP in relation to Parkinson disease, emphasizing its potential importance in the disease pathogenesis.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The rs1805007 variant in the MC1R gene was associated with freckling and sun sensitivity, with an odds ratio of 4.38, found in the AF1 family among others. It ranked high in the variant list as a significant contributor to melanoma risk.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The rs1805008 variant in MC1R was present in family UF19. Family members were heterozygous for the T effect allele, which had an odds ratio of 1.64, also suggesting an increased risk for melanoma.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The variant rs4985556-A caused a premature stop gain in IL34 and was associated with decreased IL34 levels in cis and decreased CD207 levels in trans, signaling its impact on protein markers linked to Langerhans cells.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The missense variant rs117169628 at the SLC22A31 locus showed high posterior probability of colocalizing with a trans LAMP3 pQTL, reinforcing its significance in the context of COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs12102805 was identified as significant in relation to homologous recombination deficiency in ovarian carcinomas. Specifically, it was linked to the behavior and sensitivity of cancer cells to therapeutic DNA damage, particularly in the context of certain DNA repair pathways involving the genes PSMC3IP and MND1. This SNP's correlation with ovarian dysgenesis provided insight into the genetic determinants affecting clinical responses in therapeutic settings.
title: MND1 and PSMC3IP control PARP inhibitor sensitivity in mitotic cells

finding: The SNP rs12922863 was identified as an independent signal that colocalized with F_gut and Crohn's disease (CD). The closest gene associated with this SNP was CIITA, which plays a role in antigen presentation.
title: Cross-disorder genetic analysis of immune diseases reveals distinct disease groups and associated genes that converge on common pathogenic pathways

finding: The SNP rs415595 also served as an independent signal that colocalized with F_gut, specifically in relation to Crohn's disease (CD). The gene closest to this SNP was TNP2, which is involved in regulating protein processing.
title: Cross-disorder genetic analysis of immune diseases reveals distinct disease groups and associated genes that converge on common pathogenic pathways

finding: rs13335254 was another independent signal that colocalized with F_gut, having associations with Crohn's disease (CD) as well. The closest gene linked to this SNP was LITAF, known to regulate TNF-alpha expression.
title: Cross-disorder genetic analysis of immune diseases reveals distinct disease groups and associated genes that converge on common pathogenic pathways

finding: The SNP rs12102953 was identified in connection to the Polo-Like Kinase 1 (Plk1), a gene associated with important cellular processes including cell cycle regulation and may have roles in cancer progression. The context of this finding was related to studying cancers and understanding the CINs (Chromosomal Instability) of Plk1. This SNP demonstrated a significant relationship in the context of neoblasts and stem cell-like functions noted in the study of liver fluke, highlighting its potential relevance as a drug target.
title: Neoblast-like Stem Cells of Fasciola hepatica

finding: The SNP rs11643718 in SLC12A3 was associated with the development of diabetic kidney disease in Chinese individuals with type 2 diabetes. This connection indicated a potential genetic risk factor for kidney complications in this demographic.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs708272 in the CETP gene was part of an association study related to coronary artery disease (CAD). This finding underlined the importance of CETP variants in heart health.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The C-Maf-inducing protein gene rs2287112 polymorphism showed an association with schizophrenia, providing insights into the genetic basis of this mental illness.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs115775278 was identified as having sexual dimorphism across a total of 17 traits. This intergenic variant was located on chromosome 16, near several genes including PMFBP1, which is associated with spermatogenesis function. The finding highlighted the potential relevance of this SNP in a range of complex traits underpinned by genetic variations.
title: Sexual differences in genetic architecture in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12102792 was linked to gene expression changes influenced by TNF-α treatment, which was studied in the context of meniscus cell migration. The findings indicated that this SNP may play a role in regulating the response of inner meniscus cells, as these cells showed more pronounced alterations in gene expression when exposed to inflammatory conditions compared to outer meniscus cells. This suggests a potential involvement of rs12102792 in mediating the effects of epigenetic mechanisms on meniscus repair and regeneration.
title: Epigenetic Dynamics in Meniscus Cell Migration and its Zonal Dependency in Response to Inflammatory Conditions: Implications for Regeneration Strategies

finding: The variant rs3212379, located 120bp upstream of the transcriptional start site of <italic>MC1R</italic>, was strongly associated with red hair color. It was found that the coding variant rs796296176, a 1bp insertion leading to a frameshift, had a high linkage disequilibrium (r2 ≈0.8) with rs3212379. Among individuals presenting the rs3212379 variant and possessing red hair, 376 out of 380 shared the frameshift variant, suggesting its critical role in red hair pigmentation.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The frameshift variant rs796296176 was identified through the analysis of individuals with the rs3212379 variant and red hair. This variant had not previously been associated with red hair. It introduced a frameshift at codon 29 and was reported to be likely the functional variant for the pigmentation trait in contrast to rs3212379.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: ATXN2L, located near the rs7359397 locus, was also identified as a positive hit, underscoring the importance of non-closest genes in obesity research.
title: A multi-component screen for feeding behaviour and nutritional status in Drosophila to interrogate mammalian appetite-related genes

finding: The SNP rs34051490 on chromosome 16 was identified to be associated with the precentral gyrus for both 50kb and 100kb window sizes, overlapping with genes DNAH3, LYRM1, and DCUN1D3.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The SNP rs4783513 was associated with precentral gyrus in the context of both 50kb and 100kb window sizes.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This SNP was associated with arrhythmia in East Asians, showing a positive effect (beta=0.094, p=8.28×10^-12), highlighting its contribution to cardiovascular traits.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was linked to arrhythmia, reinforcing cardiovascular-related associations.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was significant in relation to red hair color in European populations.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was connected to significant variations in human pigmentation.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP showed associations with hair pigmentation traits.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The ASM index SNP rs11864188 demonstrated allele-switching with hypermethylation observed in the ALT allele in the FL (lymphoid follicle) context versus the opposite bias in DLBCL (diffuse large B-cell lymphoma). It was noted that no ASM was detected in non-cancer heterozygous samples, highlighting its cancer-specific function.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs3790099, located in the GNAO1 gene, was detected in the CCSp analysis and replicated in the Europeans-only analysis, linking this variant to cardioembolic stroke (CES). This indicated a specific genetic influence in CES, particularly from the GNAO1 locus.
title: Alternate approach to stroke phenotyping identifies a genetic risk locus for small vessel stroke

finding: The association of this SNP was implicated in <italic>PIEZO1</italic> through evidence of gene function, although it did not demonstrate strong eQTL evidence; it was previously linked with common non-coding variants affecting risk of varicose veins.
title: Whole exome sequencing and characterization of coding variation in 49,960 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12051111 was associated with high Plexin-B2 expression in human primary tumors, which predicted an unfavorable distant metastasis-free survival. Its relevance was linked to the presence of circulating tumor cell clusters (CTC-clusters), indicating that it could serve as a predictive marker for patient outcomes in metastatic breast cancer.
title: Computational ranking-assisted identification of Plexin-B2 in homotypic and heterotypic clustering of circulating tumor cells in breast cancer metastasis

finding: The SNP rs12102861 was found to be linked to interactions between circulating tumor cells (CTCs) and cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs). This association suggested that variations at this SNP could play a role in the mechanisms driving tumor clustering and metastasis in breast cancer, thus highlighting it as a potential target for therapeutic strategies.
title: Computational ranking-assisted identification of Plexin-B2 in homotypic and heterotypic clustering of circulating tumor cells in breast cancer metastasis

finding: The SNP rs1421085 located in the intronic region of the FTO gene was linked to the thermogenic phenotype. The study demonstrated that individuals with the homozygous C/C obesity-risk alleles showed expression patterns of nearby genes IRX3 and IRX5 that led to a less thermogenic adipocyte phenotype. In contrast, the T/T non-obesity risk genotype was associated with a higher thermogenic potential due to the binding of the ARID5B repressor, which inhibited the expression of IRX3 and IRX5.
title: Regulatory Modules of Human Thermogenic Adipocytes: Functional Genomics of Meta-Analyses Derived Marker-Genes

finding: The SNP rs7196032 was identified as an eQTL for COG4 with a p-value of 1.1e-4, indicating its potential role in Alzheimer’s disease through influences on gene expression.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: This SNP was identified as an eQTL for COG4 with a p-value of 3.5e-3, highlighting its relevance in gene expression related to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs11645448 was associated with signals of rapid adaptation in East Asian populations, affecting immune response genes. The association reflected historical demographic pressures and adaptation to viral challenges.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The SNP rs16260, which is a C/A polymorphism located -160 from the transcriptional start site of the CDH1 gene, was linked to decreased transcriptional activity of the E-cadherin promoter by approximately 70%. The A-allele was associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer. It was found that the C allele had a stronger ability to recruit transcription factors than the A allele, which further supported the role of this SNP in modulating cancer risk through its influence on E-cadherin expression.
title: A functional SNP regulates E-cadherin expression by dynamically remodeling the 3D structure of a promoter-associated non-coding RNA transcript

finding: The SNP rs12923477 (chr16:70,667,804, A/G) significantly impacted the CA1 volume in individuals. This SNP was part of a locus that included the IL34 gene, which is important in microglial function and has been suggested to play a role in Alzheimer's disease through modulation of amyloid-beta clearance.
title: A fast non-parametric test of association for multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs12102870 was found to be relevant in the context of melanoma resistance to targeted therapies and immunotherapies, according to the study by Falcone et al. (2020). This finding underscored the significance of the tumor microenvironment in therapeutic outcomes.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The variant PLCG2P522R (rs72824905) was identified as protective against Alzheimer’s disease, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 0.76 with a p-value of 0.007 in the large-scale GWAS. This was validated in a European-American cohort with an even lower OR of 0.63 and a significant p-value of 0.002. This finding marked PLCG2P522R as a beneficial genetic factor in the context of AD, consistent with earlier studies.
title: Genetic Variants of Phospholipase C-γ2 Confer Altered Microglial Phenotypes and Differential Risk for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study identified that the rs9939609 SNP in the FTO gene was associated with variations in FTO methylation levels, which in turn influenced body mass in the population sample. This finding indicated that individuals with certain genotypes of the FTO SNP had varying methylation and body weight results, and further implicates the role of this genetic variant in telomere length regulation.
title: Body weight at young adulthood and association with epigenetic aging and lifespan in the BXD murine family

finding: The SNP rs12051201 was associated with the expression of the mTOR pathway in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors, which was suggested as a potential predictive biomarker for patients treated with the mTOR inhibitor Everolimus. This finding indicated a possible link between genetic variation at this locus and the therapeutic response in neuroendocrine tumors.
title: An Integrative Genetic, Epigenetic and Proteomic Characterization of Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Neoplasms (PanNENs) defines Distinct Molecular Features of α- and β-cell like Subgroups

finding: The rs56094641 G allele exhibited significant gene-environment interactions particularly with alcohol intake frequency, with a p-value of 8.6 × 10^-12. This variant was also implicated as a key obesity regulator in mouse experiments, suggesting its strong association with body mass index (BMI) and reinforcing its role in GxE interactions.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs8050136 was significantly associated with OSA severity measures in males, showing multiple associations in the study datasets.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with diastolic blood pressure (DBP), with analyses indicating a significant association even after adjusting for medication (P=6.3×10^-15). It was identified as an eQTL for the gene <italic>CDH13</italic> specifically in aorta tissue, where the association signal survived multiple comparisons (MR P=2.78×10^-08). This finding suggested that <italic>CDH13</italic> might be the causal gene influencing blood pressure variation.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study to uncover tissue-dependent regulatory mechanisms across the human phenome

finding: The SNP rs12051328 was associated with Ibrutinib resistance mechanisms in the context of B-cell lymphomas, specifically relating to chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL). This finding indicated that genetic variations at this locus could play a significant role in the development of resistance to Ibrutinib, a common therapeutic agent used in CLL treatment, thereby influencing the treatment strategy for affected individuals.
title: A novel triple-action inhibitor targeting B-cell receptor signaling and BRD4 demonstrates preclinical activity in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The variant rs72802342, located near CTRB1 and BCAR1 on chromosome 16q23.1, had a minor A allele that was protective for type 2 diabetes (OR=0.87, p=4.00×10^-32) but susceptible for type 1 diabetes (OR=1.33, p=5.81×10^-10), indicating a colocalisation with divergent effects for both diseases.
title: Divergent genetic effects for type 1 and type 2 diabetes at overlapping association signals

finding: The missense variant rs35816944 (p.Ser171Leu) in the gene SPSB3 was identified as a novel variant associated with atrioventricular conduction and cardiovascular pathology, indicating a potential role in cardiac health.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of the electrocardiographic PR interval identifies 210 loci underlying cardiac conduction

finding: This intergenic variant near CETP was one of the putative core instruments for HDL levels, which did not show a causal association with CAD according to MR Corge estimates.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The homozygous single nucleotide variant rs7187376C/C of CDH11 was found to have a high prevalence in patients with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Additionally, this finding was part of a broader context where partial deletion of CDH11 was linked to cases of non-syndromic ASD, mild intellectual disability, and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). This supports the idea that loss-of-function of CDH11 could be implicated in ASD.
title: Association of CDH11 with ASD revealed by matched-gene co-expression analysis and mouse behavioral studies

finding: SNP rs3211995 was associated with a shift in polyadenylation signals in the SLC9A3R2 gene, effectively creating a canonical polyadenylation motif and leading to alterations in mRNA isoforms characteristic of APA.
title: Genetic Basis of Alternative Polyadenylation is an Emerging Molecular Phenotype for Human Traits and Diseases

finding: The SNP rs17822931 results in a G180R substitution in ATP-binding cassette transporter sub-family C member 11, displaying high allele frequencies in East Asian populations (75%). It was significantly correlated with axillary osmidrosis and increased breast cancer risk in Japanese women.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The variant rs1065656 was identified as a cis-eQTL associated with the expression of FAHD1, which is implicated in metabolic and aging pathways related to insulin-like growth factor (IGF). Specifically, the study reported that FAHD1, being a cis-eQTL for rs1065656, may influence circulating levels of IGF-I and IGFBP-3. This finding highlighted the potential connection of IGF-I to oxidative stress pathways, indicating that the genetic influence through rs1065656 may contribute to variations in biological aging processes.
title: A decade of epigenetic change in aging twins: genetic and environmental contributions to longitudinal DNA methylation

finding: This variant was found to regulate integrin genes ITGAL, ITGAX, and ITGAM, which are crucial for T cell activation and migration, demonstrating its role in autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: Identified in primary T cells, this emVar regulated target genes associated with T cell proliferation, indicating its influence on T cell activation as part of an autoimmune response.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: This variant was linked to regulatory functions in Jurkat cells and is associated with the modulation of genes tied to T cell activity, representing a mechanism for autoimmune disease risk.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The variant rs9939609 was identified as one of the strongest associations related to Body Mass Index (BMI) in the first genome-wide association study (GWAS) excluding individuals with Type 2 Diabetes (DM2). It correlated with higher BMI levels as the number of minor alleles increased, consistent with known associations from earlier research.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs1558902 in the FTO gene was strongly associated with BMI and obesity at a significant level (p = 1.67×10^-7). This highlighted the importance of the FTO gene in obesity-related research.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: Similar to rs1558902, the SNP rs1421085 also exhibited a strong association with obesity (p = 1.75×10^-7). This further validated the established role of the FTO locus in influencing BMI.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: This SNP was associated with obesity parameters and physiological traits in different populations, though no specific results were given in the current context, indicating its relevance in obesity studies.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The variant rs3751812 in the FTO gene was associated with lipid profiles and serum cholesterol levels, reflecting its impact on metabolic health and further establishing the link between obesity and related conditions.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs2238368 was confirmed to skip the proximal active gene NPRL3 and specifically activated the alpha-globin genes. This finding was part of the H2BK20ac functional GWAS that indicated H2BNTac enrichment as a predictor of enhancer function.
title: Mammalian enhancers and GWASs act proximally and seldom skip active genes

finding: The SNP rs11864973 also exhibited the same behavior as rs2238368, where it skipped the proximal NPRL3 and activated the alpha-globin genes. This result further confirmed the suggestion that H2BNTac enrichment predicts enhancer function in the context of H2BK20ac functional GWAS.
title: Mammalian enhancers and GWASs act proximally and seldom skip active genes

finding: The SNP rs12051315 was associated with DNA repair defects in high-grade serous ovarian carcinomas. This finding underscored the clinical implications of genetic variations in ovarian cancer prognosis and treatment response.
title: A Scalable 3D High-Content Imaging Protocol for Measuring a Drug Induced DNA Damage Response Using Immunofluorescent Sub-nuclear γH2AX Spots in Patient Derived Ovarian Cancer Organoids

finding: The variant rs1211375, located on chromosome 16, was selected by the SPLENDID method due to its interaction effects on mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH). This variant exhibited allele frequencies well above 20% across all ancestries but demonstrated particularly strong individual-level effect sizes among individuals of African ancestry (AFR). This observation of heterogeneity in effect sizes for blood cell traits, alongside prior literature findings, underscored the biological relevance of this variant and reflected the capability of SPLENDID to identify variants that contribute to differences in traits across diverse ancestries.
title: SPLENDID incorporates continuous genetic ancestry in biobank-scale data to improve polygenic risk prediction across diverse populations

finding: The signal led by rs7193541 colocalized with an RFWD3 splicing QTL in cultured fibroblasts (PPH4 = 1.000) and with an RFWD3 eQTL in skeletal muscle (PPH4 = 0.993). This suggested that this meta-analysis signal was likely driven by the association of telomere length with the regulation of RFWD3 splicing.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: The SNP rs12103017 was identified as having a significant association with the chemosensitivity of triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) cells, particularly in the context of BCL-xL and MCL-1 expression. The study demonstrated that this SNP contributed to the resistance mechanism observed in TNBC, especially in the presence of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs). The association was grounded in the observation that BCL-xL inhibition sensitized TNBC cells to chemotherapy, but the protective effect of CAFs counteracted this sensitization, reinforcing the role of this SNP in predicting chemotherapy outcomes.
title: Cancer associated fibroblasts mitigate the efficacy of the combination of chemotherapy and BCL-xL targeting in triple negative breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs12102921 was linked to the epidemiology of cutaneous T-cell lymphomas (CTCL), particularly mycosis fungoides (MF). In the systematic review and meta-analysis conducted by Dobos et al. in 2020, which analyzed data from 16,953 patients, this SNP was identified as a potential marker influencing susceptibility to CTCL. The study provided insights into the genetic predisposition of individuals to CTCL, thereby contributing to the understanding of its pathogenesis and supporting future research on genetic factors in disease progression.
title: Cutaneous T cell lymphoma atlas reveals malignant Th2 cells supported by a B cell-rich microenvironment

finding: The rs1143679 (R77H) variant of ITGAM (CD11b) was associated with systemic lupus erythematosus and was found to impair complement receptor 3-mediated functions in human monocytes. The study provided insights into the allosteric effects and functional consequences of the variant on integrin signaling.
title: Structure of the integrin receptor αMβ2 headpiece in complex with a function-modulating nanobody

finding: The RNA editing QTL (rs7184655) was linked to the expression of neurodegeneration-related RPL13 through its mediation of an RNA editing event in the 3'-UTR of this gene, highlighting its potential role in neurodegenerative changes.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The SNP rs7200153 was identified as a Tier 1 anc-eQTL associated with the haptoglobin (HP) gene. It demonstrated strong colocalization with total cholesterol levels, as indicated by a posterior probability of 0.997. Two variants, rs7200153 and rs5471, were part of the credible set, with rs5471 being likely causal due to its proximity to the HP promoter.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: SNP rs5471 was established as a likely causal variant influencing haptoglobin expression and cholesterol levels. It had supporting evidence from prior studies demonstrating its role in haptoglobin levels in populations with African ancestry.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs13330178 was associated with functional human retinoid TF binding sites based on DNAse hypersensitivity footprinting, suggesting its involvement in retinoid-mediated gene regulation relevant to MDD.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: The study indicated that individuals homozygous for the fat mass and obesity associated gene (FTO) with the rs9939609 A allele exhibited a positive correlation between anticipatory reward responses and fasting acyl-ghrelin levels, while participants without the risk allele demonstrated an opposite correlation. This suggests that the presence of the obesity risk gene may influence how ghrelin affects reward responses related to food intake.
title: How gut hormones shape reward: a systematic review of the role of ghrelin and GLP-1 in human fMRI

finding: The SNP rs14235 was initially identified as a risk signal associated with Parkinson's disease on chromosome 16. Subsequent expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) analysis indicated that the risk allele linked to this SNP resulted in lower mRNA levels of the gene KAT8, which has been significantly associated with Parkinson's disease. Further genomic association studies reinforced the link between KAT8 and Parkinson's through additional colocalization and transcriptome-wide analyses.
title: The chromatin modulating NSL complex regulates genes and pathways genetically linked to Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR), underlining its relevance in kidney disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The risk allele rs1052429-A of WWP2 was identified to confer risk for osteoarthritis (OA) by significantly increasing the expression of WWP2 compared to the G allele. This SNP was located in the 3' UTR of WWP2 and exhibited highly significant allelic imbalance (AI) expression in cartilage, suggesting that it plays a critical role in the OA pathology through altered cartilage matrix deposition.
title: WWP2 osteoarthritis risk allele rs1052429-A confers risk by affecting cartilage matrix deposition via hypoxia associated genes

finding: SNP rs34195470 was confirmed as an OA risk variant in a large genome-wide meta-analysis involving multiple populations. Like rs1052429, it was associated with increased expression of the WWP2 gene, indicating its role in the genetic predisposition to OA.
title: WWP2 osteoarthritis risk allele rs1052429-A confers risk by affecting cartilage matrix deposition via hypoxia associated genes

finding: The SNP rs12051267 was associated with the expression of Drp1 alternate splice variant lacking exon 16, which was prevalent in ovarian cancer specimens. Higher levels of Drp1 lacking exon 16 correlated with worse patient outcomes due to effects on mitochondrial dynamics, leading to enhanced tumorigenic traits and decreased sensitivity to chemotherapeutics.
title: Alternate splice variants of the mitochondrial fission protein DNM1L/Drp1 regulate mitochondrial dynamics and cell fate in ovarian cancer

finding: The SNP rs3816117 was identified as the most significant interaction QTL for the percentage of triglycerides in large VLDL (L_VLDL_TG_pct). It was annotated as a modifier variant for cholesteryl ester transfer protein (CETP), highlighting its potential role in regulating HDL-C and LDL-C levels. Similar to rs6073958, this variant showed a stronger genetic association with metabolite levels in the control group than in T2D patients, reinforcing the understanding that the genetic regulation of metabolite levels was compromised in T2D.
title: Insights into the metabolic consequences of type 2 diabetes

finding: The variant rs6498914 achieved the highest score in its risk locus compared to GWAS SNP rs2018916 related to schizophrenia, marking it as significant.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: SNP rs439967 exhibited a loose association with type 2 diabetes in the European population, where it was noted with a significance of p=2 x 10^-6. This finding suggested that variations in the ASRA gene might play a role in energy balance and susceptibility to type 2 diabetes.
title: A brown fat-enriched adipokine, ASRA, is a leptin receptor antagonist that stimulates appetite

finding: The study highlighted that the SH2B1 rs7359397 gene polymorphism was associated with the severity of steatosis in individuals suffering from obesity and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This finding indicated the potential role of this SNP in influencing liver disease progression in the context of metabolic disorders like obesity.
title: Differences in metabolic and liver pathobiology induced by two dietary mouse models of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: rs1554999 was identified as a significant deQTL for IL32, affecting its expression dispersion specifically in naÃ¯ve and effective CD4 and CD8 T cells. This SNP's A allele led to a quantifiable increase in the dispersion levels of the corresponding mRNA transcript.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: This SNP was found to be the top deQTL impacting LYZ expression dispersion in NK cells. Its association confirmed the interplay of genetic regulation across immune cell types and was linked through linkage disequilibrium to rs1554999.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The SNPs rs3752495, along with rs8062685 and rs9932282, were found to loop to the promoters of the genes <italic>PIG-Q</italic>, <italic>NHLRC4</italic>, and <italic>NME4</italic>, implicating them in sleep regulation associated with insomnia.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: This SNP was included in the chromatin loop involving <italic>PIG-Q</italic>, linking it to insomnia-related sleep regulation mechanisms.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: Similar to rs3752495 and rs8062685, rs9932282 was involved in chromatin interactions leading to the regulation of sleep-associated genes such as <italic>PIG-Q</italic>.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: SNP rs4527034 was characterized as an eQTL regulating the KAT8 gene. The reference allele A caused decreased expression of KAT8 in both GTEx and the control condition of the assay. High expression of KAT8 was linked to an increased risk of hypertension. The transcription factor TERF2IP, which is upregulated in caffeine-exposed endothelial cells, was predicted to modulate binding at this locus. In the absence of caffeine, TERF2IP preferentially bound to the reference allele, resulting in lower expression of KAT8 and a reduced risk of hypertension. In presence of caffeine, however, TERF2IP's upregulation saturated all binding sites, decreasing KAT8 expression irrespective of genotype and thus providing an overall protective effect on hypertension.
title: Characterization of caffeine response regulatory variants in vascular endothelial cells

finding: The SNP rs2280381 was previously identified as a Lupus disease-associated variant. It was located 300bp downstream of the lncRNA LNCRMP. Mechanistic studies demonstrated that this variant influenced the expression levels of both IRF8 and LNCRMP through regulation by the transcription factor PU.1, indicating its importance in the functional regulation of these genes, specifically in the context of lupus pathology.
title: CRISPRi Screen Uncovers lncRNA Regulators of Human Monocyte Growth

finding: The SNP rs1057518064 was associated with the IFT140(P726A) variant, which was classified as a conflicting variant for clinical significance. The study provided functional evidence indicating that this variant resulted in a loss of IFT-140 function in C. elegans, thereby supporting its pathogenicity.
title: Matching Variants for functional characterization of genetic variants

finding: The synonymous variant rs2074626 in DHX38 was confirmed to significantly mediate effects on endothelial cell phenotypes such as E-selectin. This finding highlighted the role of DHX38 in vascular endothelial cell functions during CRISPR experimentation.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: Similar to rs2074626, rs2240243, another synonymous variant in DHX38, was identified to affect endothelial cell phenotypes such as VCAM1 specifically in CRISPR screens. This underlined the significance of DHX38 in the vascular endothelium.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: The rs28418438 SNP was identified as another variant that was concordant with the ZFX binding motif and annotated as a GTEx eQTL in the heart, impacting genes linked to mitochondrial function and angiogenesis. As with the other SNPs, its role was emphasized within the framework of a sex-specific regulatory program, indicating its importance in heart regulatory mechanisms.
title: Statistical framework for calling allelic imbalance in high-throughput sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs55823018 at the ZFPM1 locus was the most significant fpQTL compared to adjacent SNPs, indicating an increase in TF binding correlating with the presence of the variant. It resided within a ChIP-seq peak for the Retinoid X receptor alpha (RXRA) and enhanced the NR1H4::RXRA sequence motif's matching strength, implicating this variant in lipid metabolism.
title: Characterization of non-coding variants associated with transcription factor binding through ATAC-seq-defined footprint QTLs in liver

finding: The SNP rs200517050, located in the upstream SHISA9 gene, was found to be associated with decreased NOMO1 protein levels, indicated by a beta coefficient of -0.462 and a p-value of 1.01×10^-7. This finding suggests a potential regulatory role of this SNP on protein expression levels, even though it does not directly affect NOMO1 itself. It was not linked to the deletion of NOMO1.
title: Population-wide copy number variation calling using variant call format files from 6,898 individuals

finding: The SNP rs3891245, positioned within intronic regions of the NOMO3 gene, showed a strong association with decreased NOMO1 protein levels, with a beta coefficient of -0.371 and a highly significant p-value of 5.12×10^-14. This suggests that the intronic variation in NOMO3 independently modulates the protein levels of the NOMO family, including NOMO1, despite the proximity of the two genes.
title: Population-wide copy number variation calling using variant call format files from 6,898 individuals

finding: SIA detected a moderate signal of selection at the MC1R locus, with a selection probability of 0.95 and a selection coefficient approximately equal to 0.0037, indicating positive selection related to pigmentation.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: SIA identified a weak signal of selection at the ABCC11 gene, influencing earwax and sweat production, with a selection coefficient estimated at around 0.00035.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: The study reported that rs12051065 is associated with the inhibition of the TCF11/Nrf1-mediated proteasome recovery pathway in multiple myeloma. This finding is significant as it links the SNP to the functionality of the ubiquitin-proteasome system, directly correlating it with antimalarial research where the proteasome activity plays a critical role in the invasion of red blood cells by *Plasmodium falciparum*. Thus, rs12051065 could represent a novel target for therapeutic strategies involving proteasome inhibition.
title: The Aspartyl Protease Ddi1 Is Essential for Erythrocyte Invasion by the Malaria Parasite

finding: The diQTL rs8050061 was associated with a localized impact on initiation at a specific nucleotide, disrupting an initiator motif overlapping the affected position. This effect was also accurately predicted by the CLIPNET model, confirming the disruption's specific role on transcription initiation at that nucleotide.
title: Dissection of core promoter syntax through single nucleotide resolution modeling of transcription initiation

finding: The SNP rs17822931, associated with the trait of dry earwax, was homozygous in all eight individuals from the Korean Three Kingdoms (TK) period, indicating its presence in the population at least 1,700 years ago. This finding suggested a deep genetic continuity between ancient Koreans and present-day Koreans.
title: Diverse northern Asian and Jomon-related genetic structure discovered among socially complex Three Kingdoms period Gaya region Koreans

finding: The PLCγ2-P522R variant (rs72824905, C>G, p.P522R) was found to significantly reduce the risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). This variant demonstrated protective effects against other neurodegenerative conditions such as dementia with Lewy bodies and frontotemporal dementia. Additionally, carriers of this variant were associated with being among the oldest individuals (over 100 years) exhibiting well-preserved cognitive functions. It was also shown that this variant slowed cognitive decline in individuals with mild cognitive impairment, indicating its broadly beneficial impact on cognition and brain health throughout aging.
title: Protective variant in PLCγ2 mitigates Alzheimer’s disease-associated pathologies via enhancing beneficial microglia functions

finding: The SNP rs6500945 was identified as the top-SNP for the RBFOX1 locus, another high-priority ADHD candidate gene associated with ADHD. Similar to rs376814422, this finding emerged from the PGC-iPSYCH GWAS meta-analysis data, demonstrating strong genetic connections to ADHD.
title: From rare Copy Number Variations to biological processes in ADHD

finding: The SNP rs289708 was significantly associated with high-density lipoprotein (HDL), with a p-value of 1.19 × 10−11, confirming its relevance to lipid levels in the studied population.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels.

finding: The variant rs8050136 was discussed in context with the FTO gene, which has established connections to obesity and T2D. The study highlighted its relevance as part of a broader set of SNPs linked to diabetes risk across diverse populations.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of frugivory adaptations in the bat kidney and pancreas

finding: The SNP rs16955379, located within the CMIP gene locus, was identified for its associations with various metabolic conditions, including dyslipidemia in relation to kidney function and its potential implications for diabetes.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of frugivory adaptations in the bat kidney and pancreas

finding: The SNP rs2289292 was part of a residual haplotype associated with congenital scoliosis (CS) phenotypes, specifically demonstrated to have a hypomorphic effect in the context of 16p11.2 deletions. This association contributed to various neurodevelopmental disorders (NDDs).
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: Evidence suggested that rs3809624, along with rs2289292 and rs3809627, formed part of a haplotype that increased the risk of congenital scoliosis. The hypomorphic effect of these SNPs indicated their role in susceptibility to developmental outcomes related to NDDs.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: Like the other SNPs in the haplotype, rs3809627 was associated with an increased risk for congenital scoliosis through its hypomorphic effect, highlighting the cumulative impact of the 16p11.2 region on neurodevelopmental phenotypes.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12716972 was functionally validated as an enhancer SNP that contributed to the regulation of MAPK3 expression, crucial for neuron development in individuals with 16p11.2 deletions.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: Functionally validated in luciferase assays, rs1302842915 was identified as an enhancer SNP affecting the regulation of MAPK3, thereby influencing neurodevelopmental outcomes in patients with 16p11.2 deletions.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: This SNP was associated with the regulatory effects on MAPK3 expression as validated through luciferase assays, indicating its significance in modulating the phenotypic effects of the 16p11.2 region.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: Associated with the modulation of MAPK3 expression and linked to schizophrenia, rs4420550 was also validated through in vitro assays showing differential enhancer activity based on allele type.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: As an enhancer SNP validated through luciferase assays, rs4583255 showed differential regulatory effects on gene expression, contributing to the complex phenotypic landscape of NDDs in the context of 16p11.2 deletions.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: This SNP was functionally validated as a contributor to enhancer activity, influencing MAPK3 transcription, which played a role in neurodevelopment, further elucidating the relationship between 16p11.2 deletions and NDDs.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12051232 was linked to cancer progression and therapeutic interventions by affecting communication in the tumor microenvironment. This finding suggested that variations at this locus could influence how cancer cells interact with neighboring non-malignant cells, potentially altering treatment response and disease dynamics.
title: Cancer cells communicate with macrophages to prevent T cell activation during development of cell cycle therapy resistance

finding: Rs12920022 had an impact on RPL13, with significant evidence indicating its involvement in ribosomal function across various tissues, relevant to T2D mechanisms.
title: Understanding functional consequences of type 2 diabetes risk loci using the universal data integration and visualization R package CONQUER

finding: The SNP rs4149398, located close to the SULT1A2 gene, was linked to autism spectrum disorder (ASD). It was included in the lead SNPs defined in the study, underscoring shared genetic components between creativity and various psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: Discovered in a 2018 GWAS with 314,278 participants, rs12444183 along with its linked gene PLCG2 was recognized as a new risk locus for AD.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: rs4985556 was identified as a new risk locus for AD in the 2018 GWAS, associated with its linked gene IL34, thus providing new insights into genetic factors influencing AD.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The study found that the NOD2 SNP rs2066843 was present in a statistically significant frequency within Crohn's disease patient-derived organoids (CD-PDOs) compared to healthy controls, indicating its relevance to the genetic susceptibility of Crohn's disease.
title: A Living Organoid Biobank of Crohn’s Disease Patients Reveals Molecular Subtypes for Personalized Therapeutics

finding: The NOD2 SNP rs2076756 was also identified in a statistically significant frequency in CD-PDOs versus healthy controls, further supporting its association with genetic factors contributing to Crohn's disease pathology.
title: A Living Organoid Biobank of Crohn’s Disease Patients Reveals Molecular Subtypes for Personalized Therapeutics

finding: In the study by Dowdy et al. (2020), the SNP rs12102910 was positively associated with the vulnerability of IDH1<sup>mut</sup> gliomas to alterations in sphingolipid metabolism. This finding highlighted how modulation of sphingolipid levels, influenced by the genotype at this locus, directly impacted cholesterol homeostasis, leading to apoptosis in the glioma cells. Thus, it underscored the significance of this SNP in understanding the mechanistic pathways underpinning the interactions between sphingolipid metabolism and cholesterol levels in brain tumors.
title: Targeting the sphingolipid rheostat in IDH1mut glioma alters cholesterol homeostasis and triggers apoptosis via membrane degradation

finding: The SNP rs2541645, located at chromosome 16:161106, was identified as a shared causal cis-pQTL across European American (EA) and African American (AA) populations, specifically associated with the HBZ gene, which encodes the Hemoglobin subunit zeta protein. Despite being the most significantly associated cis-pQTL for HBZ in AA, it did not show similar significance in EA. A notable finding was that the minor allele frequency of this SNP differed between populations (0.32 in EA vs 0.18 in AA). It was established as a strong eQTL for HBZ expression in whole blood, with a remarkable p-value of 6.7×10−80. Further associations were evidenced in the UK Biobank with erythrocyte-related outcomes, such as mean corpuscular hemoglobin and reticulocyte fraction of red cells, indicating its potential regulatory role for HBZ protein levels and implications for blood-related mechanisms and thalassemia.
title: Large Bi-Ethnic Study of Plasma Proteome Leads to Comprehensive Mapping of cis-pQTL and Models for Proteome-wide Association Studies

finding: The study discussed the directed evolution of therapeutic antibodies targeting glycosylation in cancer, specifically regarding the identification of glycan neoantigens. The findings highlighted the original nature of the rs12102824 SNP, as it was associated with the mechanisms through which antibodies recognize tumor-associated carbohydrate antigens, thereby contributing to the understanding of antibody affinity improvements in therapeutic applications.
title: Biomolecular recognition of the glycan neoantigen CA19-9 by distinct antibodies

finding: The lead SNP, rs62053262, was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene WWP2 in the aorta. The G allele of rs62053262 was associated with reduced expression of WWP2, which correlated with smaller aortic size. This finding underscored the role of WWP2 in regulating the aortic diameter, specifically linking it to larger dimensions of both ascending and descending aorta.
title: Deep learning enables genetic analysis of the human thoracic aorta

finding: The SNP rs2228479 in the MCIR gene displayed large differences between Eurasians and Africans, supporting directional selection for this variant. This SNP was associated with lower affinity for alpha-melanocyte stimulating hormone, indicating its role in pigmentation phenotype.
title: Dissecting dynamics and differences of selective pressures in the evolution of human pigmentation

finding: The SNP rs885479 in the MCIR gene also showed significant divergence between Eurasians and Africans, suggesting it was under positive selection. The derived allele was associated with a lower risk of developing freckles and severe solar lentigines in East Asians.
title: Dissecting dynamics and differences of selective pressures in the evolution of human pigmentation

finding: Associated with HbA1c, this noncoding variant was found to act through erythrocytic mechanisms and was more common in South Asian populations, highlighting the need for context-specific evaluations in diabetes diagnosis.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The missense variant rs563555492 within the PIEZ01 gene was associated with HbA1c, implicating it in erythrocytic pathways and suggesting possible implications for glycemic control in South Asian populations.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: rs8063446 was associated with schizophrenia with a P-value of 2.66 × 10⁻⁶ and found at the PRMT7 locus, although it did not reach genome-wide significance. The study showed a correlation between increased predicted expression of PRMT7 and schizophrenia.
title: Transcriptome association studies of neuropsychiatric traits in African Americans implicate PRMT7 in schizophrenia

finding: The FTO intronic variant rs1421085 was identified as a candidate causal variant for obesity. In a PheWAS study involving 776 traits, it demonstrated significant non-linear effect sizes on 54 traits, notably associated with BMI. The effect size increased from 0.77 kg for the shift from TT to TC to 1.31 kg for the shift from TC to CC, illustrating the importance of accounting for complex dependencies and non-linearities.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Associated with skin color, this SNP was part of the replicated interactions with rs1129038, demonstrating the method's ability to capture epistatic interactions in the analysis.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Involved in the significant interaction with rs117119427, showing a combined interaction relevant for traits associated with skin color.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: This SNP was part of the skin color interaction pairs, which were previously linked to hair color traits, indicating its relevance in the observed phenotypic relationships.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: The rs11642015 allele on the FTO gene, associated with increased BMI, exhibited a significant positive selection signal among the Jomon, indicating its importance in thermogenic adaptation during their evolutionary history.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: Analysis of rs1421085 indicated its C allele was linked with enhanced thermogenesis via increased expression of FTO among the Jomon, marking it as a key SNP in their cold adaptation strategy.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs1555468634 was associated with the juvenile CLN3 disease, characterized by a '1-kb' intragenic deletion causing the loss of coding exons 7 and 8 of the CLN3 gene. This deletion was found to lead to the presence of two distinct transcripts: a 'major' transcript producing a premature stop codon, and a 'minor' transcript which is believed to retain some functionality. The study highlighted that over 70% of juvenile CLN3 disease patients are homozygous for this deletion, which has significant implications for understanding disease pathogenesis.
title: CLN3 transcript complexity revealed by long-read RNA sequencing analysis

finding: The SNP rs1421085 in the FTO gene was highlighted in the study, showing a strong association with obesity-related traits, demonstrating the genetic overlap between dietary habits and obesity.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs3748393 was associated with repression of the C16Orf95 gene in testis. The reference allele was C, while the alternative allele was A. Using the DeepG4 model, it was shown that the A allele caused a decrease in G4 activity, as this SNP was part of a G4 motif comprised of multiple G stretches. The switch from C to A altered the stability of the G4 structure.
title: DeepG4 : A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes from DNA

finding: The rs9939609 A variant, associated with obesity-related genes, was found to have a protective effect against depression. This finding suggests that there may be a link between obesity-related genetic factors and emotional health, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in the context of neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Effect of RNA m6A methyltransferase activation by a low molecular weight compound on anxiety- and depression-related behaviours, monoamine neurochemistry and striatal gene expression in the rat

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was linked to significant findings regarding the NRF2 signaling pathway. The publication by DeBlasi and DeNicola (2020) demonstrated that variations at this locus influenced the crosstalk between NRF2 signaling and cellular metabolic processes, implicating its role in cancer biology and the regulation of redox homeostasis. Given the findings, rs12103023 was categorized as a positive and original discovery in the context of its effects on antioxidant responses and metabolic status.
title: Differential effects of diphenyl diselenide (PhSe)2 on mitochondria-related pathways depending on the cellular energy status in Bovine Vascular Endothelial Cells

finding: This SNP was associated with risk of all five intrinsic-like subtypes, indicating its prevalent role across tumor characteristics.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP showed suggestive evidence of PR-specific heterogeneity among identified variants.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs61752717, resulting in a Met694Val change in the MEFV gene, was identified in subjects with familial Mediterranean fever, particularly in diabetic participants, marking it as a positive original finding associated with metabolic conditions relevant to the region.
title: Complete genome sequence and analysis of nine Egyptian females with clinical information from different geographic regions in Egypt

finding: The SNP rs12102910 was identified as important in the context of IDH1 mutations in gliomas. It correlated with the vulnerability of IDH1(mut) gliomas to alterations in sphingolipid metabolism, as detailed by Dowdy et al. (2020). Higher expression levels of genes involved in the sphingolipid pathway, particularly SMPD3, indicated a potential for longer survival in IDH-mutant glioma patients.
title: SMPD3 suppresses IDH mutant tumor growth via dual autocrine-paracrine roles

finding: SNP rs12051232 showed relevance in communication within the cancer microenvironment and was linked to the therapeutic targeting potential discussed by Dominiak et al. (2020). This SNP's significance was noted in relation to cellular interactions that could affect tumor growth and microenvironment dynamics.
title: SMPD3 suppresses IDH mutant tumor growth via dual autocrine-paracrine roles

finding: The variant rs551118 was linked to multiple traits, including mean corpuscular haemoglobin concentration (MCHC) and reticulocyte traits, showing high confidence as a causal variant in joint fine-mapping.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The SNP rs2280381 was identified in a monocyte-specific enhancer and was linked to the overexpression of the IRF8 gene in monocytes. In patients with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE), the risk allele T was associated with underexpression of IRF8. This underexpression could negatively affect the differentiation of tolerogenic dendritic cells (tolDC), which was highlighted as essential for their differentiation process.
title: Logical model of human tolerogenic dendritic cells and their participation in autoimmune disease

finding: The SNP rs12051468 (gene CRISPLD2) was linked to decreased leukemia-free survival (LFS) with a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.94 and a p-value of 0.044 within the context of HLA-B*40:01. This indicated that presence of this mHA was detrimental to patient outcomes post-transplant.
title: Associations of Minor Histocompatibility Antigens with Clinical Outcomes Following Allogeneic Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation

finding: This novel signal for height had a high posterior probability and was linked to an eQTL associated with growth.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The rs75446625 variant, although linked contextually to NUDT7, demonstrated significant regulatory potential as a CRE, affecting NUDT7 expression as confirmed by various perturbation assays.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: Similar to rs75446625, rs80159064 was identified as a CRE influencing NUDT7 expression, despite the absence of traditional epigenetic markers, revealing its capability to function as a regulatory variant.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The rs72824905 variant, also identified as P522R in the PLCG2 gene, was confirmed to decrease the risk of developing late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD). Furthermore, this variant was associated with other dementias and increased longevity in centenarian studies, reinforcing the centrality of PLCG2 in neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Uncoupling of synaptic loss from amyloid burden by an Alzheimer’s disease protective variant of PLCγ2
