finding: This SNP was identified as a leading causal variant of Crohn's disease and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), supported by its presence in relevant databases such as DisGeNet and SNPedia.
title: Detecting Genetic Interactions with Visible Neural Networks

finding: This SNP was also categorized as a leading causal variant for Crohn's disease and IBD, confirming its significance in the context of the NOD2 gene along with rs2066844.
title: Detecting Genetic Interactions with Visible Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs761726261 disrupted CEBPB regulation of HMOX2, which is correlated with significant biological processes important in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: This SNP also disrupted CEBPB regulation of HMOX2, revealing its potential role in AD pathogenesis.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs537044906 disrupted RFX2 regulation of HMOX2 and was identified among significant non-coding SNPs related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: This SNP disrupted SPI1 regulation of HMOX2 and was associated with microglial regulation, highlighting its relevance in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11866312 was identified as a strong candidate as the C allele predicted to disrupt FOXA1 binding motif, crucial due to its location within the intron of ABCC11, which encodes a trans-membrane transporter.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The SNP rs12051108 was noted for its role in acquired resistance to Trastuzumab in HER2-positive breast cancer, demonstrating its critical involvement in breast cancer pathways influenced by YAP/TEAD.
title: Structure-based discovery of a novel small-molecule inhibitor of TEAD palmitoylation with anticancer activity

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was implicated in cancer research within the work of Czowski et al. (2020), which discussed the findings related to pH dynamics in cancer cells. The study suggested that transcriptional regulation influenced by this SNP could affect pHi regulation and consequently, cancer cell behaviors like proliferation.
title: Single-cell intracellular pH dynamics regulate the cell cycle by timing G1 exit and the G2 transition

finding: The rs118024138 variant within the BBS2 gene was significantly associated with HDL cholesterol levels, demonstrating a strong link between common genetic variants affecting ciliary genes and lipid metabolism.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: A significant association was detected for the rs9790 variant within the CLUAP1 gene with serum creatinine levels, providing evidence of the gene's role in renal function.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs8050047 was associated with the adenomatous polyposis coli (APC) protein and its dynamics at the centrosome. The study demonstrated that the enhanced understanding of the APC-CEP290 complex could clarify the underlying mechanisms contributing to CEP290-related ciliopathies, suggesting that variations at this SNP may influence the function and localization of the APC protein, thereby impacting related phenotypes.
title: Ciliary protein CEP290 regulates focal adhesion via microtubule system in non-ciliated cells1

finding: Coupled with temperament traits, reinforcing the significance of genetic diversity in behavioral characteristics in specific sheep breeds.
title: IDENTIFICATION OF CANDIDATE GENES AND PATHWAYS LINKED TO THE TEMPERAMENT TRAIT IN SHEEP

finding: The SNP rs9927316 was identified as being associated with rheumatoid arthritis. It was located within the enhancer region associated with the IRF8 gene, which is part of the Putative Transcriptional Condensate (PTC) identified in a B-cell to macrophage transdifferentiation system. This finding highlighted the potential role of this enhancer in mediating immune-related gene expression and its relevance to autoimmune disorders.
title: Synergistic and antagonistic activities of IRF8 and FOS enhancer pairs during an immune cell fate switch

finding: The SNP rs62053992, found in the LINC01572 gene on chromosome 16, showed a significant association with neck or shoulder pain (P = 4.50 x 10^-8) in the UK Biobank cohort. It was weakly replicated in the GS:SFHS at P = 0.0202.
title: A genome-wide association study finds genetic variants associated with neck or shoulder pain in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs62032983 was predicted to reduce expression of the gene DCTN5 across all cell types. The interpretation of the model linked this effect to the disruption of a binding site for the transcription factor ELF1, which is known to be ubiquitously expressed. This finding highlighted scooby's ability to connect variant effects to regulatory mechanisms across different cell types.
title: scooby: Modeling multi-modal genomic profiles from DNA sequence at single-cell resolution

finding: The analysis showed that the LPS reQTL for the SNP rs78885610 resulted in a reduced strength of association with DNAAF1 expression during LPS stimulation compared to baseline. Additionally, LPS treatment caused a differential expression for DNAAF1 with a log fold change (LFC) of 1.33, and an adjusted P-value less than 1e-16.
title: The human microglia responsome: a resource to better understand microglia states in health and disease

finding: The rs7192245 SNP was identified as a PBS-specific sQTL that colocalized with the KneeOA GWAS signal (index variant rs34195470), indicating its association with OA risk and regulation of the WWP2 gene.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The rs34195470 GWAS signal connected to the KneeOA phenotype was associated with the rs7192245 sQTL, demonstrating an impact on splicing at the WWP2 gene locus, which has been implicated in OA via previous methylation studies.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs9788910 was linked to liver enzyme levels and showed an enrichment association with IL32, indicating a potential role in NAFLD-related metabolic processes.
title: Deciphering the genetic links between NAFLD and co-occurring conditions using a liver gene regulatory network

finding: The study found that the presence of SNP rs12051143 was associated with differential B-cell receptor signaling requirements for adhesion of Mantle Cell Lymphoma (MCL) cells to stromal cells. This finding suggested that the SNP contributed to the mechanism of MCL pathogenesis and provided insights into the genetic factors influencing lymphoma cell behavior in a tumor microenvironment.
title: Differential transcriptional reprogramming by wild type and lymphoma-associated mutant MYC proteins as B-cells convert to lymphoma-like cells

finding: The SNP rs12102740 was associated with modulation of cancer-induced bone pain in a study conducted by Diaz-delCastillo et al. (2020). The researchers found that alterations in this SNP were linked to changes in pain sensitivity related to neuropathic conditions, suggesting that it plays a role in the underlying mechanisms of pain associated with breast cancer bone metastases.
title: CCR2-targeting pepducins reduce T cell-nociceptor interaction driving bone cancer pain

finding: SNP rs7499892 replaced rs1800961 in the final model concerning HDL phenotype effects identified using IHT.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs3764261 was identified in association with HDL in the dichotomized analysis using IHT.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The variant rs7203922 associated with PLLP was observed in the putamen, showing its role in myelin structure and potential effects on neurodegenerative conditions.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs77924615, considered the causal variant at the UMOD-PDILT locus, was associated with eGFR decline. Initially, the effect of one additional A allele on eGFR decline adjusted for baseline eGFR was estimated to be 0.092 mls/min/year. However, after applying the adapted MR-Horse method, this effect was attenuated to 0.067 mls/min/year, with a 95% credible interval ranging from 0.056 to 0.078, indicating the SNP's true association with kidney function decline.
title: An application of the MR-Horse method to reduce selection bias in genome-wide association studies of disease progression

finding: The study highlighted the protective role of the hypermorphic variant in PLCG2, specifically the SNP rs72824905, against Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. This was evident from previous findings that established a connection between reduced PLCG2 expression and altered microglial phenotypes. The involvement of PLCG2 in immune signaling and its correlation with neuroinflammation indicated that this variant might mitigate some of the AD-related pathophysiology, particularly in microglial activation associated with high dietary fat/sugar diets.
title: Plcg2M28L interacts with high fat-high sugar diet to accelerate Alzheimer’s disease-relevant phenotypes in mice

finding: SNP rs7193263, situated in an intron of RBFOX1 on 16p13.3, was associated with all analyzed psychiatric disorders except anorexia nervosa (AN), with a meta-analysis p-value of 5.59 x 10^-11. This SNP's implications were linked to neuronal development and aggressive behavior, indicating its importance in psychiatric traits.
title: Genome wide meta-analysis identifies genomic relationships, novel loci, and pleiotropic mechanisms across eight psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs551118, found upstream of PIEZO1 and CDT1, was linked with hemoglobin concentration with a p-value of 5.18e-100 and a beta coefficient of -0.0451, highlighting its relevance in population-specific risk factors.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: SNP rs28711261 was associated with the nearby CpG cg16218405. This association was connected to the ACD gene, which regulates DNA methylation at distal CpG sites (cg14343953) through a cis-meQTL-mediation mechanism.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The rs8054034 SNP was identified as a cis-meQTL that showed a high number of co-localization events, being connected to 13 different genes including DUS2 and ZDHHC1, exemplifying its impact on local genetic regulation.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: SNP rs9936153, as part of the ACD gene's regulatory mechanisms, co-localized with multiple meQTLs and was involved in distal effects influencing DNA methylation through the TPP1 protein, which maintains telomere length.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs12935253 was connected with the ACD gene and was one of several eQTLs that mediated connections to downstream affectations of methylation at distal CpG sites.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: This variant, part of the ACD gene's regulation, co-localized with multiple CpGs, contributing to a network of genetic regulations on DNA methylation.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs7187776 was associated with waist and hip circumference phenotypes, showing co-localization with eQTLs for the TUFM and SPNS1 genes, which are involved in metabolic processes, indicating a potential cis-meQTL-mediation mechanism.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The frameshift mutation rs2066847 in the NOD2 gene was identified as a significant genetic variant associated with an increased risk for Crohn's disease (CD). This mutation was consistently linked to CD across multiple studies and populations, demonstrating a high relative risk ratio of 17.6 for individuals with homozygous genotype status compared to wild-type individuals.
title: MecCog: A knowledge representation framework for genetic disease mechanism

finding: The lead SNP rs12920150 was identified as associated with hay fever, located close to CBLN1, and was novel in the context of previous studies on hay fever.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: rs11647589 acted as an eQTL associated with 3-phenylpropionate and was intronic in ACSM5. This SNP was noted for its effects across 16 tissues, indicating its significant regulatory role.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: This SNP, linked to an unknown metabolite X-117478, was identified as an eQTL and was found intronic in ACSM2A. Its association was reported in the context of its regulatory influence in specific tissues.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: This SNP was associated with indolepropionate and was located 38.5 Kb away from ACSM5, illustrated as an eQTL present in 14 different tissues, showcasing its molecular influence.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: The rs16955379 polymorphism in the CMIP gene was associated with dyslipidemia and the clinicopathological features of IgA nephropathy. This SNP was highlighted for its role in the context of FFA-induced lipotoxicity, particularly relating to how genetic risk for type 2 diabetes intersects with environmental exposure to harmful free fatty acids.
title: FALCON systematically interrogates free fatty acid biology and identifies a novel mediator of lipotoxicity

finding: The SNP rs8060056 was associated with targeted vaccination against human alpha-lactalbumin, which was explored for its potential role in immunotherapy and primary immunoprevention strategies for triple negative breast cancer. This association highlighted the relevance of alpha-lactalbumin in anti-tumor activities and its underlying genetic influences.
title: Effect of Alpha-Lactalbumin and Lactoferrin Oleic Acid Complexes on Chromatin Structural Organization

finding: The rs2230433 variant, which encoded the antithetical epitope of HNA-5a, was found to have significant allele frequency variation across global subpopulations: 71.4% in South Asians, 13.4% in East Asians, 30.1% in Europeans, 42.1% in Africans, and 18.9% in Americans. No alloantibodies against this form had been reported or characterized so far.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The rs1143679 variant, pivotal in the determination of either 61Arg or its antithetical form 61His, exhibited a frequency range of 0-0.15 across global subpopulations. This finding aligned with prior reports indicating that HNA-4a allele frequencies in most global populations ranged from 0.9-1.0.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The SNP rs12102878 was associated with variation in cancer signaling dynamics, particularly in the context of the ErbB receptor signaling pathway. Its original finding linked it to certain resilience mechanisms in cancer patients, contributing to the understanding of cancer subpopulations derived from RNA sequencing data.
title: Functional annotation-driven unsupervised clustering of single-cell transcriptomes

finding: The rs12447029 variant was characterized as a MG-specific sc-caQTL that strengthened the binding of NFE2L2, a transcription factor expressed in multiple cell types, to a MG-specific enhancer. This variant was also identified as a sc-eQTL for GRIN2A in MG.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs4293393 was mapped to an open chromatin region in the UMOD locus. This finding demonstrated greater accessibility in intact renal cortex compared to tubular epithelial cells cultured in 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), indicating its relevance in kidney function and possible associations with kidney disease.
title: Multi-omic Characterization of Human Tubular Epithelial Cell Response to Serum

finding: The SNP rs12917707 was also identified in an open chromatin region within the UMOD locus, similar to rs4293393. The observation of increased accessibility in intact renal cortex relative to cultured tubules suggests a significant role in the regulatory mechanisms underlying kidney health and diseases.
title: Multi-omic Characterization of Human Tubular Epithelial Cell Response to Serum

finding: The SNP rs11866328 was identified as affecting disease progression in chronic HBV infection, based on a genome-wide association study involving DNA pooling. This finding pertained to the GRIN2A gene.
title: The interaction of DNA repair factors ASCC2 and ASCC3 is affected by somatic cancer mutations

finding: The intronic variant rs12932325 in GTF3C1 was reported to be associated with complex processing speed and suggested interaction with Alzheimer’s disease-related biomarkers.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The intronic rs73529530 variant in ATP2A1 was found to be associated with episodic memory, presenting its regulatory significance in memory-forming processes.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: rs4788084 showed significant colocalization with both sQTL and gene expression QTL (eQTL) data in relation to the SULT1A2 gene. This SNP was linked to differences in splicing, notably the inclusion rate of Exon 4 in SULT1A2 transcripts, which correlated with increased COPD risk.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: rs750155 was noted for its colocalization in relation to the GWAS data associated with SULT1A2, although its specific contribution to splicing was less emphasized than that of rs4788084. Nonetheless, it likely played a role in the complex interactions related to COPD.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: This SNP showed significant colocalization with eQTL data regarding gene expression of SULT1A2. Although its specific role in splicing compared to rs4788084 was not detailed, it supported the linkage of SULT1A2 as a causative gene for COPD.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: The rare missense variant rs200779411 was strongly associated with 16q CNN-LOH events, providing an odds ratio (OR) of 28 (95% confidence interval: 17-45) and a highly significant p-value of 7.3 x 10^-20. This association consistently duplicated the CTU2 risk allele (p=0.022), highlighting the importance of CTU2 in genome integrity maintenance.
title: The genomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in Japan

finding: The VKORC1 rs7294 variant was identified among samples with very high read depth, demonstrating successful genotyping. However, some discordant homozygote samples were mis-called as heterozygotes due to interpretation challenges with the variant's read depth. Despite initial inaccuracies, these discrepancies could be clarified by analyzing the respective BAM files, indicating that the variant's genotyping results were reliable when properly assessed.
title: A Multiplex Pharmacogenetics Assay using the MinION Nanopore Sequencing Device

finding: The VKORC1 rs9923231 variant had discrepancies in genotyping, where homozygote samples were inaccurately called as heterozygotes. This specific variant exhibited the least accurate genotyping, although it had a relatively high read depth greater than 100. Similar to rs7294, mis-calls were resolvable through direct examination of the BAM files, affirming that proper post-analysis can yield accurate results for this variant.
title: A Multiplex Pharmacogenetics Assay using the MinION Nanopore Sequencing Device

finding: The rs12102823 SNP was identified as a significant finding relating to immune cell responses, particularly in the context of nivolumab treatment for advanced melanoma. It was highlighted as a candidate prognostic biomarker influenced by the regulation of B cell genes, suggesting its role in distinguishing between responder and non-responder patients to immune checkpoint inhibitors.
title: Immune cell networks uncover candidate biomarkers of cancer immunotherapy response

finding: The variant rs1805007 in the MC1R gene was associated with increased pain sensitivity measured by pain sensitivity questionnaire (PSQ) scores. This finding related to the genetic basis of red hair color phenotype. It demonstrated that individuals carrying this variant exhibited an additive effect on pain sensitivity.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: The variant rs1805008 in the MC1R gene was linked to increased pain sensitivity as reflected in PSQ scores. This highlight explained the contribution of MC1R variants to the redhead phenotype and pain sensitivity profile through the additive model of these non-synonymous variants.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: The rs1805009 variant in the MC1R gene was found to be associated with heightened pain sensitivity according to the PSQ scores. This variant was part of the non-synonymous loss-of-function mutations that contribute to the red hair color phenotype and an increased perception of pain.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: This SNP was recognized for its link to PR (P<sub>PR</sub>=2.16×10^-4), suggesting its possible role in hormonal dynamics.
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs811692 was connected to CD4 T cell proportion and was involved in TGF-β signaling regulation through its association with EID2.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs2864754 had a trans-eQTL association with the gene ITGB2 in natural killer cells, linking it to leukocyte adhesion processes.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs9927316 exhibited strong association with myeloid cells, particularly within an accessible chromatin peak near the IRF8 gene, suggesting its regulatory influence in myeloid and B cell differentiation, supported by significant statistical validation.
title: The Chromatin Landscape of Pathogenic Transcriptional Cell States in Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs12051139 was associated with findings relating to the immunomodulatory functions of adenoviral vectors in cancer therapy. Specifically, it was highlighted in the context of enhancing the efficacy of adenoviral vectors, such as those derived from species D adenoviruses, which express the E3/49K protein. This SNP was particularly noted for its role in the interaction of E3/49K with CD45, a critical regulator of T cell activation, possibly influencing therapeutic outcomes in cancer treatment by modulating immune responses.
title: Enforced dimerization of CD45 by the adenovirus E3/49K protein inhibits T cell receptor signaling

finding: The CDH13 gene variant rs3865188 had observable effects on adiponectin levels, suggesting its influence on T2DM risk factors in the studied population.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The C allele of rs9930307 was protective for schizophrenia and was associated with decreased chromatin accessibility in neurons at a specific caPeak. It disrupted TP53 motifs, which indicated a possible contribution to schizophrenia risk through altered regulation of downstream targets.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The variant rs1861867 was identified as having a >99% probability of being causal for FTO expression in skeletal muscle. This finding highlighted the distinction between the causal variants for body mass index (BMI) and those for FTO expression, indicating that while rs558902 was associated with BMI, it likely represented a different causal variant than rs1861867, which was linked specifically to FTO expression.
title: Widespread dose-dependent effects of RNA expression and splicing on complex diseases and traits

finding: The variant rs8046545 was reported as associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) and was found to be a cis-eQTL for the gene SH2B1 in the pancreas. This association suggested that the GWAS signal might indicate SH2B1 as a potential causal gene for T2D, as decreased levels of SH2B1 were correlated with insulin resistance and subsequent development of obesity and diabetes.
title: A Transcriptomic and Proteomic Atlas of Obesity and Type 2 Diabetes in Cynomolgus Monkeys

finding: The rs7206410 SNP located in the FTO gene was linked to obesity and BMI. This association was previously observed in a preceding study and confirmed in the current research.
title: A genome-wide association study of neonatal metabolites

finding: The SNP rs12102966 showed a correlation with high PD-L1/CD274 expression in monocytes and blood dendritic cells, identified as a risk factor in lung cancer patients undergoing PD1 inhibitor therapy. This established a direct link between this SNP and the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibitors in lung cancer treatment.
title: Advancing CAR T-Cell Therapy: Simultaneously Attack Tumor and Immunosuppressive Cells in the Tumor Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs8049439, located near ATXN2L, was involved as an outlier for traits associated with BMI. Its role further confirmed associations within the social determinants of health linked to schooling.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs2302178 was found to be associated with the gene CLDN1, yielding a q-value FDR ≤ 0.095. This association was extended from a prior cis-association with HS3ST6, highlighting its importance in trans-eQTL relationships among the 2,768 differentially-expressed genes in lung tissue.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The SNP rs9989419 was commonly detected by both the normal priors method and Bayestrat, previously reported to be associated with HDL-C. This reinforces its established role in lipid metabolism.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: The rs2066847_G>GC frameshift variant was causally linked to inflammatory bowel disease phenotypes, aligning with existing literature establishing its pathogenic significance.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The variant rs77924615, located 5' of the gene UMOD associated with kidney function, significantly contributed to eGFR<sub>Cr-Cys</sub> levels. It was identified as having low linkage disequilibrium (LD) with other variants and fell within a kidney cCRE, indicating its potential role as a causal variant influencing kidney function.
title: Variants in tubule epithelial regulatory elements mediate most heritable differences in human kidney function

finding: The SNP rs3814883 was associated with tissue contrast across multiple cortical areas in a newly identified cluster, highlighting its relevance in imaging-derived phenotypes.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2549095, located in CLEC18A, was found to associate with numerous imaging-derived phenotypes in higher-order cortical regions and had been linked to cardiovascular conditions affecting ischemic stroke classification.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs72785089 was noted to be associated with additional health-related non-imaging-derived phenotypes and was a proxy for significant genetic variants observed in cortical tissue contrast studies.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs17822931 was found to be strongly associated with wet earwax and bromhidrosis, specifically highlighted in a study involving a Chinese family. This finding relates to phenotypes concerning specific traits in human genetics.
title: Demogenomic modeling of the timing and the processes of early European farmers differentiation

finding: The G-allele at SNP rs1800124 in ERCC4, identified in Riva-I cells, was linked to weaker DNA-protein binding, resulting in decreased DNA repair efficiency.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: SNP rs1800566 in NQO1 was noted for its association with response to alkylating agents including cyclophosphamide, ifosfamide, and platinum compounds, indicating its relevance in drug response for DLBCL treatment.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: At the GP2 locus, rs4238595 was fine-mapped as part of a signal involving three variants which had high co-accessibility with the GP2 promoter in acinar cells, indicating a strong contribution to T1D risk through pathways linked to pancreatic function.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The variant rs8060932 was part of the GP2 locus signal and co-accessibility with the promoter of GP2 in acinar cells contributed to the cumulative PPA demonstrating its relevance in T1D risk mechanisms.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The rs72802342 variant at the BCAR1 loci was identified as co-accessible with the CTRB1 and CTRB2 gene promoters in acinar cells, indicating its potential role in T1D through exocrine pancreatic pathways.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The variant rs138099003 at 16q23 was linked to T1D, identifying it as one of the rare risk variants with significant disease association through regulatory pathways.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The IL4R gene variant rs1805010 was associated with increased Th17 cell frequency and poorer clinical outcomes in rheumatoid arthritis, indicating its relevance in autoimmune processes.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs1805005 was identified as having a significant association with hair colour, specifically with low eumelanin pigmentation. It was part of a credible set containing variants with a log10(BF) value of 3303.25, indicating its importance in the genetic architecture of hair colour.
title: Multi-ancestry tandem repeat association study of hair colour using exome-wide sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1805007 was associated with hair colour variation, particularly linked to low eumelanin. It exhibited a high posterior inclusion probability in fine-mapping analyses, highlighting its established role in influencing hair pigmentation.
title: Multi-ancestry tandem repeat association study of hair colour using exome-wide sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1805008 was found to influence hair colour, contributing to low eumelanin levels. Like the other SNPs in the study, it was included in a credible set with a log10(BF) value reaching as high as 8994.18, reinforcing its significance in hair pigmentation diversity.
title: Multi-ancestry tandem repeat association study of hair colour using exome-wide sequencing

finding: The SNP rs9930984, located in the ADAMTS18 gene, was significantly associated with the TP53 R249S mutation in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) cases exposed to aflatoxin B1 (AFB1) and hepatitis B virus (HBV). Patients carrying the TT genotype at this locus showed increased risk for the R249S mutation, with an odds ratio of 4.94 (95% CI = 1.48–16.52) within an additive genetic model. Additionally, mRNA expression levels of ADAMTS18 were lower in non-tumor tissues from individuals with the TT genotype compared to those with the GT genotype.
title: Genome-wide association study of TP53 R249S mutation in hepatocellular carcinoma with aflatoxin B1 exposure and hepatitis B virus infection in Guangxi

finding: The rare coding variant rs72824905, corresponding to the R522 variant of PLCG2, was associated with a significant protective effect against Alzheimer's disease (AD), with a p-value of 5.38×10^-10 and an Odds Ratio of 0.68. Functional analysis indicated that microglia and induced pluripotent stem cell-derived microglia-like cells harboring the R522 mutation exhibited enhanced calcium store release and impaired phagocytosis due to hyperfunctionality of PLCGamma2, suggesting direct impacts on immune-related cellular functions in the context of AD.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease protective P522R variant of PLCG2, consistently enhances stimulus-dependent PLCγ2 activation, depleting substrate and altering cell function

finding: The SNP rs56407236 was associated with the FAM157C gene in significant eQTLs in blood, while the original study listed it with PRDM7 as its closest gene.
title: snpXplorer: a web application to explore human SNP-associations and annotate SNP-sets

finding: The SNP rs9939609 was associated with body fat accumulation and its effects were found to be accentuated by low physical activity. This original finding related to obesity phenotypes, demonstrating a clear link between the FTO gene variant and increased body fat percentage.
title: Estimating narrow-sense heritability from genome-wide data in admixed populations

finding: SNP rs12102727 was implicated in the advancement of personalized medicine approaches using tumor spheroids in neuroblastoma, enhancing treatment customization based on individual tumor biology.
title: Red blood cell-derived extracellular vesicles with miR-204 mimic loading for pediatric neuroblastoma treatment

finding: The CDH13 gene variant rs9940180 was found to contribute to schizophrenia risk in the North Indian population, indicating its relevance in psychiatric conditions.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The MMP2 gene variant rs243865 was associated with clinical findings in Alzheimer's disease patients, highlighting its possible implication in pathophysiology.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The study provided evidence that the presence of the A allele of the FTO gene polymorphism rs9939609 was significantly associated with obesity and higher body mass index (BMI) values, with the frequency of the A allele showing a marked decrease in individuals aged 86-100 compared to younger age groups. This finding suggested a pleiotropic effect where the A allele carriers demonstrate increased fitness during reproductive age but decreased fitness in older age.
title: Evaluation of the possible association of Body Mass Index and four metabolic gene polymorphisms with longevity in an Italian cohort: a role for APOE, eNOS, and FTO gene polymorphisms

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was reported in the study by Czowski et al. (2020) to be associated with cancer-related pH dynamics. The authors emphasized the role of pHello and transcriptional regulation in these processes, highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding how pHi variations could influence cancer cell behaviors, specifically through pathways involving proteostasis and molecular tools for manipulation.
title: An optogenetic tool to raise intracellular pH in single cells and drive localized membrane dynamics

finding: The study identified the eQTL rs16940186, which was located approximately 80 kb downstream of the gene IRF8. This eQTL was shown to play a crucial role specifically in stomach epithelial cells. The analysis successfully demonstrated that the peak-to-gene link for IRF8 coincided with the OCR where this eQTL was situated, achieving a correlation coefficient (R) of 0.61 and a false discovery rate (FDR) of 3.8e-03, indicating a significant tissue-specific accessibility.
title: cisDynet: an integrated platform for modeling gene-regulatory dynamics and networks

finding: The association of SNP rs12051232 with communication mechanisms in the cancer microenvironment was established. This work underscored the relevance of cellular signaling in tumor biology, which could influence therapeutic strategies targeting cell communication.
title: High-frequency extracellular spiking in electrically-active cancer cells

finding: The PLCγ2 S707Y variant (rs397514562) was identified as a key genetic cause of severe autoinflammatory symptoms and immune dysregulation, categorized under the APLAID (autoinflammation and PLCγ2-associated antibody deficiency and immune dysregulation) classification. This strong hypermorphic variant was shown to exhibit increased enzymatic activity compared to wild type, leading to diminished phagocytosis and cytokine production in microglia.
title: The hypermorphic PLCγ2 S707Y variant dysregulates microglial cell function – insight into PLCγ2 activation in brain health and disease, and opportunities for therapeutic modulation

finding: The PLCγ2 P522R variant (rs72824905) was associated with protection against late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) and helped support healthy aging, demonstrating a mildly hypermorphic effect on microglial functions. In mouse models, this variant was linked to enhanced microglial activity that contained amyloid plaques and improved working memory.
title: The hypermorphic PLCγ2 S707Y variant dysregulates microglial cell function – insight into PLCγ2 activation in brain health and disease, and opportunities for therapeutic modulation

finding: The rs3752495 SNP was identified as a causal insomnia risk variant located within an intron of the WDR90 gene, influencing the splicing and transcript expression of the neighboring gene PIG-Q. Notably, luciferase assays indicated that the risk allele of rs3752495 resulted in a 2.5-fold increase in luciferase expression, demonstrating its regulatory potential. The allele-specific effect significantly increased luciferase activity when comparing the risk allele to the non-risk allele, hence establishing rs3752495 as a key player in insomnia pathways.
title: Perturbation of the insomnia WDR90 GWAS locus pinpoints rs3752495 as a causal variant influencing distal expression of neighboring gene, PIG-Q

finding: The PLCG2*M28L variant was found to be associated with LOAD, connecting its role as a key protein in the microglial activation response to Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs78193826, located at locus 16p12.3, was identified through a meta-analysis of three GWAS studies as a novel risk locus for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population, with an odds ratio of 1.46 indicating a 46% increase in risk per copy of the minor T allele. This SNP is a nonsynonymous variant in the GP2 gene and was deemed highly deleterious.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs117267808, also at locus 16p12.3, was implicated in significant associations with pancreatic cancer risk, demonstrating similar patterns of risk as rs78193826, and highlighted the potential for shared genetic susceptibility factors between pancreatic cancer and type 2 diabetes.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs73541251, located at 16p12.3, was part of the significant findings related to pancreatic cancer susceptibility with similar odds ratios to rs78193826, indicating its relevance in shared genetic risks with metabolic traits.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs4632135 was nominally significantly associated with pancreatic cancer risk in a replication cohort, while maintaining consistent direction and magnitude with findings from the primary GWAS, suggesting it could also contribute to susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP chr16:23621362:C:T, identified as a stop gain variant in the PALB2 gene, was linked to breast cancer in the same analysis as the CHEK2 variant. It was shown to have a notably higher odds ratio (OR) of 4.48 and a p-value of 6.92×10^−14, with a minor allele count of 316 among the study participants. This association again represented a significant finding in adults without a prior ascertainment of cancer, highlighting the previously underestimated risks posed by this variant.
title: Sequencing of 53,831 diverse genomes from the NHLBI TOPMed Program
